loans.name: Sarah Atieno

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and a married mother of two children aged 13 and 15. Sarah sells Irish potatos in the Kibuye market. Her plan is to expand her business to become a wholesaler of potatoes supplying hotels and restaurants in her area. She says that her work can be challenging because if she doesn’t have enough customers her potatoes spoil.

Sarah hopes that her children can get a proper education. Sarah is also a Community healthcare worker, which means that she visits the sick, elderly, and vulnerable people in her community on a regular basis. As a Community Healthcare Worker, she wishes that she could have more money to support the people that she visits – many of them are undernourished.

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Sarah. For more information about K-MET, click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24.

loans.use: To purchse more stock

loans.name: Berdishukur

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Отаев Бердишукур- мужчина средних лет, отец 4х детей. Жена Хамрокулова С  воспитывает детей, помогая мужу .Бердишукур кормит свою семью за счёт откормленных скотов, которым занимается более 15 лет. Каждую неделю  на базарный день Бердишукур бывает на скотном рынке покупает скот и приносит домой. Его жена и дети присматривают за скотом несколько месяцев, когда скот будет готов муж продает его на базаре за хорошие деньги. На выручку он покупает семье необходимые вещи и ещё и  неготовых бычков на откорм. Бердишукур  сотрудничает с нашей организацией и благодарен нам за то что мы поддержали его с финансовой стороны. Он намерен в дальнейшем работать с нами.
texts.en:
Berdishukur O. is a middle-aged man and a father of 4 children. His wife, S. Hamrokulova, raises their children and helps her husband. Berdishukur supports his family by raising livestock. He has been involved in this business for over 15 years. Berdishukur visits a livestock market, buys livestock and takes it home every week on market days. His wife and children look after the livestock for several months, and, once the livestock is ready, Berdishukur sells it at a market for good money. He uses the profits to purchase necessary items for his family and to purchase more livestock to feed. Berdishukur cooperates with our organization and is grateful to us for the financial support. He intends to work with us in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke M. is 39 years old and married with four children. She has a phone booth where she sells rechargeable phone cards and accessories. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 in order to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and accessories to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards and accessories

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en: Ayobami is 29 years old and married with a child. He molds blocks to sell. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more raw materials to mold more blocks to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to mold more blocks to sell

loans.name: Olukunle

texts.en: Olukunle O. is 62 years old and married with 3 children. He has a poultry farm where he rears birds. He is requesting the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more poultry feed to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin T. is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothes of various colors and sizes. She is requesting  the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mansuma

texts.en:
Mansuma (her husband is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, settled in the Mahmudlu-1 village.

Mansuma was born in 1971. She is a mother of 2 children. Three years ago, this family started a cattle-breeding business.

Now this family needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to expand their cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 5 calves

loans.name: Modinatu

texts.en: Modinatu D. is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Iyiola

texts.en: Iyiola is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells cosmetics. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: Tawa A. is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells plastic bowls. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more plastic bowls to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic bowls to sell

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
  Раимбердиев  Исроил –мужчина 51  лет, женат и имеет одного сына и дочь.Жена Джумабоева Ойимнисо –домохозяйка,занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Исроил откармливает скот несколько лет. У него в основном дойные коровы,которых доет его жена.Это семейное дело приносит большую пользу и доход семье. Молоко они продают,у себя каждый день есть молочные продукты для детей. У дойной коровы  теленок которого тоже Исроил откармливает несколько месяцев.Таким образом, они зарабатывают себе на жизнь.
texts.en:
Isroil R. is a 51-year-old man, who is married and has one son and a daughter. His wife, Oyimniso Djumaboeva is a homemaker, who is involved in feeding cattle. Isroil has been raising livestock for several years. He primarily has dairy cows that his wife milks. This family business brings a big benefit and income for the family. They sell milk and have dairy products for their children every day. One of the dairy cows has a calf that Isroil has been also raising for several months. This is how he earns his living.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Маманов Икром мужчина проживающий в посёлке Учбог, работает разнорабочим на заказ. Он имеет одну корову и трое молодых баранов. Его основной доход не хватает на полноценное проживание. Поэтому он имеет дополнительный бизнес, откорм и продажи скота. Для увеличения численности баранов Икром желает получить следующий кредит.
Он ни разу не нарушал условий организации и состоит в числе положительных клиентов.
texts.en:
Ikrom M. is a man, who lives in the Uchbog village and works as a contractor handyman. He has one cow and three young rams. His main salary is not enough for a fulfilling living. This is why Ikrom has his own business of feeding and selling livestock. Ikrom wishes to obtain another loan in order to increase the quantity of rams. He never violated any conditions of our organization and is considered to be one of our positive clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ruzikul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Бобокулов Рузикул  удачно погасив очередной кредит хочет получить ещё, на закуп несколько голов баранов и корма для них. Сам работает в бригаде по строительству домов, по уходу за скотом ему помогает его жена и дети. Его жена занимается домашними делами и производством пряжи. Рузикул на следующий кредит планирует отремонтировать хлев и покрыть крышу шифером.
texts.en:
Having successfully repaid yet another loan, Ruzikul B. wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase several heads of rams and feed for them. Ruzikul works in a construction team and builds houses. His wife and children help him take care of the livestock. His wife does domestic work and makes yarn. Ruzikul plans to use the following loan to repair a barn and slate the roof.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais was born in 1968. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan and settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Kayidish, specifically built for IDPs. He is married, has four children.

Eight years ago Mais started his dairy business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy two cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows to improve his dairy business

loans.name: Aegamberdi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Эрбоев Эгамберди кредитор в организации уже второй год. На следующий кредит он планирует  купить два молодых быка и откормив их продать с прибылью. Эгамберди работает электриком в колхозе, также по выходным работает на вызов. Для получения дополнительного дохода Эгамберди  постоянно занимается куплей скота. На снимке Эгамберди в день выдачи займа.
texts.en:
Aegamberdi A. has been a client of our organization for the second year already. He plans to use his next loan to purchase two young bulls, raise and sell them at a profit. Aegamberdi works as an electrician at a collective farm and also works on-call on weekends. In order to supplement his income, Aegamberdi is constantly involved in livestock sales. The photograph shows Aegamberdi on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en: Esperanca A. D. G. W. is a 46-year-old native of Gaza province. When she was very young she moved from Gaza to Maputo with her family because her mother and father were transferred to Maputo for their work with the ministry of health. Esperanca is married and is the mother or three children between the ages of 10 and 24. She also supports a niece and a nephew. Esperanca is soliciting this loan to assist in the construction of her home. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku. Esperanca is employed at the Pfukane association and earns around MT 7,000 per month. She previously worked at the ADPP association, an NGO focused on community development. In the future, she would like to open up a small store. She plans on doing this with the help of microfinance. About housing in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique, many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: astou D. est une ancienne de la caisse de bayelaye.elle s'active dans la petite restauration en vendant le petit dejeuner devant chez elle.elle sollicite un credit de trois cent(300 000)frs en vue de mieux rentabiliser son activite en achetant en gros les produits qu'elle utilise pour preparer son petit dejeuner.l'augmentation de ses benefices lui permettre de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou D. is a long-time member of the Bayelaye bank. She is active in food service selling breakfast in front of her house. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs with the aim of making her business more profitable by buying in bulk the products she uses for making her breakfast foods. Increasing her profits allows her to assist her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Хаким

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Каримов Хаким-мужчина 1960 года рождения ,женат имеет 3-х детей ,жена Каримова Мухаббат .Клиент берёт кредит  для расширения  своего бизнеса .Хаким занимается купля продажей и откормом  скота .Ему в этом помогает отец . Дополнительно Хаким занимается  выращиванием и переработкой сельхозпродуктов , чтобы пополнить свой семейный бюджет.На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить 2-х  бычков, откормив их в течении3-4 месяцев, продаст их за хорошую цену.

loans.use: для покупки скота

loans.name: Goshgar

texts.en:
Goshgar was born in 1978. He is married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in the Fuzuli region.

Goshgar has been in the dairy business for four years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy three cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy three cows to improve his dairy business

loans.name: Elvanis' Group

texts.en:
R. Elvanis is the leader of the Rwempiri subgroup in Ibanda. She is a happy and friendly lady with a business of selling milk from her farm animals in Rwemipiyafu village. She has a herd of cattle that give her over 60 liters of milk every day. Once she sells, she is able to settle her family needs including her children’s school fees and general upkeep. She is also a farmer with banana plantations from where she gets matooke (plantain) for sale.

Elvanis is seeking her 9th loan and, this time, she would like to employ labor that can help cultivate a fresh piece of land for increased farming as well as buying two more cows for farm expansion.

loans.use: To employ farm labor and to buy more cows for her dairy

loans.name: Namasa Dyphine

texts.en:
Namasa is the married mother of four children ages 7, 9, 13, and 17. She runs a mobile salon with which she goes to her customers to offer her services. She also has a small shop where they can come to her.

Some of the challenges that Namasa faces in her business are paying the expensive transportation costs and having enough equipment to serve all the clients that come to her. She would like to use her loan to buy more equipment for her salon, including a blow dryer and an extra sit-down hair dryer.

Namasa also raises poultry on the side, and would like to buy some more chickens. Eventually, she would like to be a wholesaler of beauty products and also grow her poultry business. Mostly, she wants to save enough money to pay for her children’s school fees. Her eldest son is entering high school soon, and that implies increased costs for her. She says that her children’s education is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: To buy a blow-dryer and a hairdryer for her salon

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Абдухакимов Абдумалик – молодой человек 30-ти лет, женат, имеет 2-х детей.
Он  занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока.Абдумалик  занимается этим бизнесом вот уже более 6-ти лет. Когда он начинал вой бизнес, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Абдумалика большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Абдумалик планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам по KIVA.
texts.en:
Abdumalik A. is a young, 30-year-old man, who is is married and has 2 children. He is involved in raising and selling livestock, and his wife is involved in processing and selling milk. Abdumalik has been in this business for over 6 years. When he first started his business, he had a very small quantity of livestock. Now, Abdumalik has a large quantity of small livestock. His wife also has one dairy cow. Abdumalik plans to purchase another dairy cow and a calf for his wife, and he is grateful to our Kiva creditors.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and calf

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty sells foodstuffs and sachet water (water in plastic bags). She has been in the business for the past six years and she has been with LAPO for the past two years. Betty is 47 years old and is married with a child.

Betty is very happy with LAPO-Kiva for the financial assistance rendered to her. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Linet Kadari

texts.en:
Linet, a married mother of five children, ages 13, 9, 7, 4.5, and 9 months, has been keeping poultry for about three years, having learned the practice from her brother-in-law. She says that she now has 32 chickens, and is able to sell their eggs. She also raises some of the chickens to sell for meat. The food to feed the chickens can be expensive, but she saves money by making a mixture of dried fish and maize to feed them.

Linet is requesting a very small loan to begin with, but has plans to ask for a larger one later on. One of the challenges she faces is keeping all of her chickens healthy, as they sometimes get sick, and medicine is very expensive. It is important to Linet that her business succeed since it is the main way that she provides the money for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Temitayo

texts.en:
Temitayo sells clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry. She is 42 years old and she has four children. She lives in Abeokuta and she is the leader of her lending group.

Temitayo is requesting the loan of N140,000 to enable her to buy more shoes, clothes and jewelry to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca is the 38-year-old mother of six children (including a set of twins!) who runs a business called “Mutumba”, a small-scale shop which carries fish and vegetables. She has been running this business for over fifteen years, and knows the trade well. Her husband works as a carpenter and also does some masonry work. Rabecca would like to see her children get a good education and become doctors or nurses.

One of the challenges that Rabecca faces is customers who buy on credit. They often take the goods, but never pay what they owe. She is very excited to be getting her loan, and can’t wait to build her business further by buying a large stock of items to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of items to sell

loans.name: Irene Apiyo

texts.en:
Irene lives in the town of Rongo in western Kenya. Her business supplies vegetables to local schools which they use to prepare meals for the children. She started selling to schools only at the beginning of this year, and has already experienced tremendous growth. She wants to take her loan so that she is equipped to meet the demands of the schools.

During the dry season, Irene’s own farm produces less, and she is forced to buy more from wholesalers. Rather than let her business suffer during this time, she wants to be able to continue being the supplier of choice for the schools.

Irene is raising her three children and is also taking care of three orphaned children. She says that the most important lesson to teach the young ones is to be skilled in different areas since versatility is so valuable in today’s changing world.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and is a widow with five children. She sells drinks, juice and pepper soup. She has been in the business for the past twenty-two years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past four years. Her previous loans were invested in her business.

Esther is requesting the loan of N120,000 to purchase more pepper soup ingredients and also more juice and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
A. Monica is the leader of the Rwempiri subgroup in Ibanda. She is a 26 year old, friendly, and the mother of two children. She also cares for her parents deep in the village.

Monica has been in the business of selling shoes from Kashonda, Kazo for eight years and she is able to make profits worth 80,000 UGX. She is grateful for the loans because they make it possible for her to have quality shoes in her stock. Also, she would like to expand into a larger business with increased stock. With the loan, Monica hopes to buy more stock to avoid shortages.

Monica prays that her children continue being healthy so that the savings she makes will cater for their school fees once they start school.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to increase her stock

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: aliou B. est un societaire qui habite non loin de la caisse de bayelaye a guediawaye ou il gere une boutique.il sollicite un credit de trois cent(300 000)frs pour renforcer son stock.ceci lui permettra de maximiser son ses benefices afin de mieux faire face a ses charges familliales.
texts.en:
Aliou B. is a member who lives near the Bayelaye bank in Guediawaye, where he manages a shop. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to bolster his inventory. This will enable him to maximize his profits in order to cope better with his family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, 45 years old and married, has nine living children ranging in age from 29 to 5 years old. A seller of second-hand clothes for over 10 years, Pamela buys them from Nairobi and sells them in a local market in Kisumu. When the post-election violence erupted in late 2007, her clothes were stolen and her kiosk was burned down. She is still trying to recover from this hardship, and business is difficult now. She says that most customers do not have good money to pay, so the business is hard to maintain.

Pamela will use the money to buy more clothes to sell, and she hopes to use the profits to educate all of her children, some of whom are in college while others are in secondary and primary school. “God willing, they will finish school,” she says.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Гуломжон Рахимов- мужчина 1969 года рождения ,женат,  имеет -х детей. Занимается откормом и купля продажей скота  на протяжении 10 лет. Он имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводства, так как занимается этим с юных лет..  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Гуломжон в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Born in 1969, Gulomjon R. is married and has children. He has been involved in buying, raising and selling livestock for 10 years. He has extensive experience in the animal husbandry field because he has been involved in it since a young age. Gulomjon buys livestock at a market, feeds it for 2-3 months and sells it at the same market. His wife processes yarn and sells it at a market, and also helps with household duties. She helps her husband with this, so that their family budget can improve. Gulomjon wants to increase the quantity of his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Eunice Anyango

texts.en:
Eunice sells cereals and other basic items at her kiosk in the town of Rongo, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She also helps care for her sister’s two children. Eunice has a dream to teach her children the value of hard work, and she is doing it by example.

Things haven’t been easy over the past year. Food prices have increased dramatically in Kenya. Eunice says that sometimes the stock you buy goes bad due to low-quality produce. Through it all, though, Eunice has a vision for her business to grow.

Eunice will use her loan to buy a bigger variety of products to attract different types of customers. She is extremely excited about the opportunity to help her business grow.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of goods

loans.name: Dora Okumu

texts.en:
Dora makes a living by selling small dried fish called omena. She also sells maize at her store in the market in Rongo, Kenya. She has been running this business for over forty-five years!

Dora is now 65 years old, and has been married for the whole time that she has had her business. Both of Dora’s children passed away, and now she is caring for the six grandchildren left behind. She pays their school fees, buys their clothes, and pays for all of their needs.

Dora says that the stock of her business is down and that she would like to boost her supply in order to get her profit levels up again. She wants to save some money every month so that she can have an emergency reserve.

The most important thing to Dora is to provide a good life for her grandchildren. She hopes that they are as smart and successful as their parents were before the passed away—one was a doctor and one was a teacher.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of vegetables

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 32 years old and married with five children. She sells drinks, wine, juice and dry gin. Rose has been in this business for the past three years and is very happy with the growth of her business. Rose has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years and is requesting a loan for $650 USD to purchase more inventory (wine, dry gin and juice) to sell in her store. She is thankful for the opportunity to receive another loan.

loans.use: To purchase more wine, dry gin and juice to sell

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de huit femmes mariées vivant dans des grandes familles polygames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Zogofina Wêrê, de la commune rurale de Sakoïba -  préfecture de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage.
Ces femmes ont pour activité hivernale  la culture de mil, d’arachide, de l’oseille de guinée, de haricot, de sésame etc.
Dans le but d’avoir  des intrants agricoles à leur disposition et de pouvoir recruter des hommes (manœuvres) pour le labour et le sarclage au début de la saison des pluies, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 1ier cycle de prêt de campagne, après avoir remboursés correctement  les 3 prêts solidaires. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 16 sacs d’engrais, 800 kg de semences de mil et d’arachide, recruter de la main d’œuvre pour le labour et le sarclage. Elles se ravitaillent en matières premières au grand marché de Ségou lors des foires hebdomadaires. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est destinée à la vente dans la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Le bénéfice est utilisé pour prendre en charge les soins de santé, les frais de scolarité des enfants, le traitement et l’achat d’aliments pour le bétail (tourteaux) afin de bien nourrir les vaches qui leurs produiront une grande quantité de lait destinée à la vente.
Elles ont pour ambition l’augmentation de la quantité de lait à produire  afin d’augmenter le volume de vente.
texts.en:
The group Sabali is composed of eight married woman living in large polygamous families. These women average 32 years of age and four children, and they all live in the village of Zogofina Wêrê, of the rural community of Sakoïba - prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and marriage. Their winter-time work involves growing millet, peanuts, hibiscus flowers, beans, sesame, etc. With the goal of obtaining farm supplies for their use and being able to recruit men (workers) for labor and weeding at the start of the rainy season, the group members turned towards Soro Yiriwaso. And they are now on their first farm loan cycle after having correctly repaid three solidarity loans. This loan will be used to buy 16 sacks of fertilizer and 800 kg of millet and peanut seeds and to recruit the manpower for labor and weeding. Essential supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Ségou during the weekly fairs. Part of the harvest is consumed at home while the other part is destined for sale to men and women customers at the Ségou weekly fair. The profit is used for covering the costs of health care and schooling for the children and for processing and purchasing fodder (meal) for the livestock in order to feed the cows well, which produce a large quantity of milk destined to be sold. The group members have the ambition to increase the amount of milk produced, so as to increase the volume to be sold.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizers,cost of labor and weeding

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Madame Djénéba  S. est âgée  de 61 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dans le quartier Pélengana  Sébénikoro de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école par refus de ses parents qui voyaient en l’école une porte de déperdition des filles, elle commença  très tôt les activités de petits commerces. Elle mena plusieurs activités mais fini par se spécialiser, après son mariage, dans la grillade de l’arachide. Cette  activité, elle l’exerce depuis 11 ans au marché château de Ségou et dans les différentes foires (lundi de Ségou et jeudi de Banankoro). Parallèlement à cette vente d’arachide grillée, elle vend également au marché château du mil  acheté les jours de foire du village de Banankoro.
C’est pour pérenniser son activité, qu’elle décida de  faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 44 mois, après 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés. 
Elle est à sa  4ème demande de prêt individuel,  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter,  3 sacs d’arachide et 10 sacs de mils. Elle s’approvisionne en arachide à Ségou et mil à Banankoro.
Madame  Djénéba  S. vend toujours  au comptant   à   une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, ce qui  lui permettra de faire face à des dépenses familiales (achat de savons, d’habits pour les enfants etc.) et de participer à des événements sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles).
Son ambition est d’avoir un montant plus élevé avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son commerce qui lui est cher.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénéba S. is 61 years old and lives with her husband and their 6 children in the neighborhood of Pélengana Sébénikoro in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having not being to school, due to the refusal of her parents who saw schooling as a road to perdition for girls, she began working in small-scale commerce. She did several businesses, but after her marriage, she stopped those in order to specialize in grilled peanuts. She has done this business for 11 years in the market of Ségou and in other markets (Monday in Ségou and Thursday in Banankoro). Alongside selling roasted peanuts, she also sells in the smaller markets the millet she purchases on the market days in Banankoro.

In order to continue her business, she decided to join the the microfinance group Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with this group for 44 months; she has completed 4 group loans and 3 individual loans - each has been fully and properly repaid. She is now on her 4th request for an individual loan. She will use this loan to purchase 3 bags of peanuts and 10 bags of millet. She gets her peanut supplies from Ségou and her millet from Banankoro.

Mrs. Djénéba S. always sells for cash to a clientele composed of men and women. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will enable her pay for her family's expenses (to buy soap, clothes for her children etc.) and to participate in social events (marriage, baptism and funerals). Her ambition is to borrow a greater amount with Soro Yiriwaso in order to run her business well, which is very important to her.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of peanuts and millet

loans.name: Ada

texts.en: Ada is 35 years old and has one child. She has a store where she sells provisions, cosmetics and drinks. She has been in the business for the past seven years and she is very happy with the growth of her business. Ada is very hardworking even if she is limited to small capital, and she is very optimistic about her business and the prosperity of her family. She lives in Lagos State. She hopes for the loan amount of $650 USD to purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, cosmetics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 30-year-old, married mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 10, 8, 6, and 4. She buys grains from farms and hires a pick-up truck to take them to the market where she sells them on the side of the road. The grains include, maize, millet, beans, green grams (lentils), and also cassava.

Carolyne hopes to grow her business bigger. She will use the loan to buy more stock so that she can sell more each day. Right now she sells 2-4 bags in 3 days and she wants to purchase 10 bags so that she can sell more. She also wants to add rice and some other foods to her stock.

Carolyne didn’t finish school, but she wants her kids to finish school and to go abroad. She wants them to grow up “not like me if possible”.

Carolyne is also a community health worker. This means that she volunteers to visit the sick and vulnerable in her community. K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional micro-finance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Carolyne. For more information about K-MET, see the partner link on the lower right side of this webpage.

loans.use: buying more stock for her little business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: For the past two years, Esther has been trading in the local market of Kasoa in Ghana. She is a married 43-year-old with five children, all of whom are in school. She is very busy selling palm oil, rice, vegetable oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc. at her local market. Esther is convinced, however, that her business will grow better with increased capital and she therefore wants a loan for $350 USD (500 GHS) to buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education and dreams of saving major parts of the income from her store for their continued schooling.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in her local food market

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah sells building material and house paints. She has been in this business for years and she has been able to use her years of experience to retain her customers. Hannah is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Hannah has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years and the loan has positively increased her business. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more building materials and house paint to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials and paint to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is happily married with three children and she is 45 years old. She lives in Lagos. She sells provisions, necklaces, and she makes bags for sale. She has been in the business for the past ten years.

Mercy has been borrowing from LAPO for the past year and the loan has positively increased her business. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions, necklaces and bag materials to enable her to make more bags to sell. This, she says will enable her meet the growing demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, necklaces and bag materials

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en:
Margaret is a forty-three-year-old woman. She is married with four children and all her four children are in school through support from government compulsory education.

Margaret is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Margaret wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her first child entering university. With the loan support she would like to increase savings to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De (Benkadi A  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe 1 de BENKADI A  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans , 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent  acheter, de l’engrais,  de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 27.5  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés du village de Marka-Coungo et Fana  après les récoltes et à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group1 of BENKADI A are married women who average 47 years of age and four children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a community seat of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work. Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth loan with the institution, and the past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment. And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 27.5 hectares. A part of their production is consumed at home, the other part is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of the village of Marka-Coungo and Fana following the harvests. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry supplies

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De (Benkadi  B  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 1 de l’association BENKADI B sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 24 hectares.
Après la récolte, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur place au village, dans le marché hebdomadaire de Marka-Coungo et à Fana, essentiellement au comptant, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group 1 of the association BENKADI B are married women who average 43 years of age and four children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a community seat of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work.  Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts.  The group members are on their fifth loan with the institution. All the preceding loans were repaid without any problems at all. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment.  And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 24 hectares.  After the harvest, part of their production is consumed at home.  The other part is sold locally to customers composed of men and women at the weekly market of Marka-Coungo and Fana in essentially cash transactions. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide nasceu na capital maputo, tem 48 anos de idade e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 16 aos 35 anos de idade. Somente as três mais novas e que vão à escola. vive somente com os filhos e sem ninguém mais por sua responsabilidade.

Sai de maputo quando seu pai perde a vida e esta porque era muito nova e sua mãe não tinha condições de lhe cuidar, é levada pelas irmãs missionárias de Maria para namaacha onde cuidaram dela dando lhe assistência. Durante a sua estadia ela aprende a fazer artesanato e crochê e anos depois juntam se com seu marido e assim teve que sair da casa das irmãs e passa a viver com seu esposo. Começa a programar os trabalhos que aprendeu, fazendo crochê e vendendo nas cooperativas. Mas, como seu trabalho era muito elogiado ela consegue fazer encomendas a grosso para uma empresa na cidade capital e com os lucros consegue comprar um terreno. Anos depois ela separa se do seu marido deixando a com 5 filhos por criar a vida fica muito difícil, mas com ajuda das irmãs missionárias ela consegue supurar as dificuldades, pois estas dão lhe um fundo e ela opta em construir quartos de aluguer, hoje é proprietária de 5 dependências das quais 2 estão em funcionamento cobrando 1.500.00MT de aluguer por mês. Para alem das dependências é proprietária de 2 bancas onde vende sacos de batata e cebola a grosso adquiridos na vizinha swazilandia a 160x20 e a 170x20 cada e revendidos em namaacha a 200x20 e a 200x20..
Consegue poupar o seu dinheiro no xitique (esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa) de 1.000.00MT que faz de 15 em 15 dias num grupo de 12 pessoas.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este e o primeiro empréstimo de Adelaide na hluvuku e com kiva. Estes 20.000.00MT serão usados para comprar material de construção para dar continuidades das suas dependências, pois não vê a hora de terminar e começar a praticar outros negócios, pois.
Esta cheia de projetos. Futuramente pretende pedir um ovo empréstimo e torna se uma grande comerciante.
texts.en:
Adelaide was born in the capital city of Maputo. She is 48 years old and has 5 children between the ages of 16-35. The youngest three still attend school and she lives only with her children—she doesn’t have any other family members in her care. She left Maputo after her father died. She was very young and her mother did not have the resources to take care of her, so she was taken to Namaacha and cared for by the missionary nuns. During her time with the nuns she learned to make handicrafts and crochet. Years later, she met her husband and left her home with the nuns. She began making crochet projects and selling them to co-ops. Her work was often praised so she was able to start making large orders for a company in the capital city. With the income from that project she bought some land. Later, she separated from her husband and was left with 5 children to care for. Her life was very difficult, but with the help of the missionaries she was able to overcome those difficulties. They gave a base and she was able to build some rooms to rent out. Today she is the owner of 5 small apartments, 2 of which are functioning and provide her with 1.500.00MT per month in rent money. She is also the owner of two market stalls where she sells large orders of potatoes and onions which she gets from neighboring Swaziland for the price of 160x20 and 170x20, then resells in Namaacha for the price of 200x20 and 200x20. She saves her money in a xitique (a traditional, rotating way of saving money). She pays 1.000.00 MT every 15 days among 12 people and each person in the rotation collects the whole account once. She has never worked with another lending company and this is her first loan with Hluyuku and with Kiva. The 20.000.00MT will be used to buy construction material for her apartments. She is very anxious to finish them so she can begin other jobs. She is full of projects! In the future she plans on taking out another loan and becoming a great saleswoman.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction material

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is single and is 35 years old. She sells foodstuffs like yams, plantain, melon and garri (roasted cassava). She is requesting the loan of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Robertha

texts.en: Robertha sells medicines and has been running her business for a long time. She is 39 years old and married with four children. She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Juliao

texts.pt:
Julião tem 23 anos de idade, nasceu em Ngonhama (uma localidade que dista 45 km do Município da Vila de Namaacha) na Fronteira da Swazilandia, vive maritalmente e é pai de uma rapariga de apenas 1 ano de idade.

Julião estudou ate a 10ª classe e teve que interromper os seus estudos quando esteve gravemente doente, após sua recuperação ele engrena no mundo dos negócios transfronterico (vendendo arros de janelas e portas que eram adquiridos na vizinha swazilandia e revendidos na capital maputo) onde consegue construir a sua própria casa e um estabelecimento comercial. Anos depois, ele muda de actividade quando o Governo Moçambicano  implementou a lei que regula a actividade( para recolher mercadoria contrabandeada no trajecto namaacha­maputo). Mudou de actividade e começou a fazer o negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e esta é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos nomeadamente arroz, feijão, amendoim e açúcar têm ganhado de lucro um valor de 3.000.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT, pois para alem da sua filha não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Propõe se a reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para compra de uma moto bomba para dar inicio na agricultura, pois na região onde vive tem uma grande fonte de água e terreno fértil.
texts.en:
Julião is 23 years old and was born in Ngonhama (about 45 km from the Vila municipality in Namaacha), on the Swaziland border. He is married and has a one year old baby. Julião studied until the 10th grade but had to stop when he became gravely ill. After he recovered he entered into the business world by buying window frames and doors in neighboring Swaziland and re-selling them in the capital of Maputo. He was able to build his own home and a commercial building. He later changed jobs when the Mozambique government implemented a law that regulated border activity—in order to monitor contraband on its way to Namaacham or Maputo. His new job was selling basic products in a small convenience store. He has never worked with other lending companies and this is his first loan, for 10.000,00MT, which he will use to increase the volume of his products. He will buy rice, beans, peanuts and sugar. He makes about 3.000.00MT and is able to save 1.000.00MT, since he is only responsible for his daughter. He pledges to repay his loan before the determined time and hopes to receive another loan in the future. He would like to purchase irrigation equipment and get started in the agricultural field, since there is a large water source and fertile land in his region.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice, beans, peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: amy B. est une ancienne societaire dela caisse de bayelaye qui est tres experimentee en credit eten couture.elle gere un atelier chez elleelle sollicite un credit decent cinquante mille(150 000)pour augmenter son fond de roulement en vue d'accroitre ses benefices.ceci lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy B. is long-time member of the bank of Bayelaye and is very experienced with loans and with dressmaking. She manages a shop in her home. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her working capital with the aim of growing her profits. This will enable her to assist her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For increasing her working capital

loans.name: Malfada

texts.pt:
Malfada S. S. is 45 years old and is a native of Gaza province. Malfada moved from Gaza province to the city of Matola during the civil war as her husband was looking for work. Malfada works in the Boane market selling a wide range of products. Her best selling products are pans and used clothing. She is able to buy pans for MT 1800 and sell them for MT 2530 and is able to buy a bundle of used clothes for MT 87.50 and sell them for MT 150. She has been in business for the last 15 years.

Malfada is requesting this loan to purchase more products for her store. In recent years she has felt pressure from competitors as the market for her products has become saturated. With her monthly salary Malfada is able to save around MT 500 with a group of 12 other people. In the future she would like to build a home and continue to send her children to school.

Malfada is the mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 15. She is a widow. Malfada studied through the 9th grade at which point she was forced to stop due to her first pregnancy. This will be Malfada's first loan with Hluvuku.

About housing in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.
texts.en:
Malfada S. S. is 45 years old and is a native of Gaza province. Malfada moved from Gaza province to the city of Matola during the civil war as her husband was looking for work. Malfada works in the Boane market selling a wide range of products. Her best selling products are pans and used clothing. She is able to buy pans for MT 1800 and sell them for MT 2530 and is able to buy a bundle of used clothes for MT 87.50 and sell them for MT 150. She has been in business for the last 15 years. Malfada is requesting this loan to purchase more products for her store. In recent years she has felt pressure from competitors as the market for her products has become saturated. With her monthly salary Malfada is able to save around MT 500 with a group of 12 other people. In the future she would like to build a home and continue to send her children to school. Malfada is the mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 15. She is a widow. Malfada studied through the 9th grade at which point she was forced to stop due to her first pregnancy. This will be Malfada's first loan with Hluvuku. About housing in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing Retail Inventory

loans.name: Joana Amelia

texts.pt:
Joana nasceu em maputo tem 33 anos de idade, e casada e mãe de apenas um filho de 15 anos este que se encontra a frequentar a o ensino geral na vila do município da vila de namaacha.

Joana sai de maputo, apos ter se casado, para o município da vila de namaacha na fronteira da suazilandia. Apos sua chegada ela ficou dois anos sem trabalhar e mais tarde conseguiu emprego numa empresa de venda de carne de vaca como promotora de vendas. Aufere mensalmente um valor de 3.000.00MT valor que não satisfaz as suas necessidades sendo assim resolveu continuar a praticar o negocio de venda de roupas diversas adquiridas na vizinha suazilandia, mas como não tinha fundo aproxima se a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT. Serão usados para comprar diversos tipos de roupas para revenda, pois já tem muitas encomendas e pretende satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.

Tem como melhores encomendas cobertores, bolsas e lençóis ganhando de lucro um valor de 3.000.00MT, pois tem viajado uma vez por mês devido à falta de tempo e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT Para alem do seu filho Joana não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

 Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto, pois conta com ajuda do seu marido e pedir um novo empréstimo para dar inicia da sua obra e sair da casa do seu patrão.
texts.en:
Joana was born in Maputo. She is 33 years old, married, and has one son who is 15 years old and attends school in Vila de Namaacha. Joana left Maputo after marrying to move to Vila de Namaacha on the border of Swaziland. Upon arrival, she didn't have work for two years and later found a job as a salesperson for a company that sells beef. Her monthly wages are 3,000,000 MT, an amount that does not cover her needs. She therefore decided to continue her business of selling clothes acquired in Swaziland, but since she didn't have sufficient funding, she came to Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan for 10,000,000 MT. She will use the money to purchase different types of clothing for resale, as she has many orders and wants to meet her customers' needs. The best orders are comforters, bags, and sheets on which she earns a profit of 3,000,000 MT. She only has time to travel once per month and has managed to save 1,000,000 MT. She does not support anyone other than her son. She is confident that she will repay her loan early, because she has help from her husband. She will then request a new loan to start building and move out of her boss's house.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Grace Wambui

texts.en: Grace Wambui M. is 59 years old. She is married to Bernard M. and they have three children. Her business is located along Nangili centre in Eldoret Town. Grace has been in her business for the past eight years and was introduced to KADET by a group member. With the loan from KADET, she intends to buy more stock of cereals and tomatoes for her food store. She wants to grow her business to become a large wholesale store and to diversify. With increased income, she hopes to educate her children to higher levels. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To procure more cereals and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Antonio Simao

texts.pt:
Antonio tem 25 anos de idade nasceu em vilanculos num distrito da província de inhambane, estudou ate 7 classes. Maritalmente e é pai de uma filha de apenas 2 anos. 

Antonio sai de vilanculos com o seu tio este que vive no município da vila namaacha uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilandia a procura de emprego. Trabalhou para o seu tio durante 2 anos onde só ganhava mensalmente um valor de 150mt, valor este que não chegava para custear as suas despesas. Em 2002, Antonio resolve fazer o seu próprio negocio com o dinheiro que havia coletado e sai da casa do tio e aluga uma dependência onde ele vive ate então pagando mensalmente um valor de 500.00MT. Actualmente é dono de um estabelecimento de venda de eletrodomésticos (cita no mercado central da vila do município de namaacha) a mais de 7 anos tem como melhor mercadoria rádios, discos e recargas para celulares adquiridos na cidade de maputo a 1.000.00mtx5 cada, a 35.00mtx50 cada e revendidos a 2.200mtx5 e 75.00MT respectivamente. Tem tido de lucro um valor de 5.000.00MT e consegue poupar por mês um valor de 1.000.00MT. É responsável pelos seus dois irmãos que vivem com ele em sua casa e tem um empregado que aufere mensalmente um valor de 1.200.00MT e encontra se a construir a sua própria casa, pois este muito ansioso em viver na sua própria casa porque viver de aluguer não e nada fácil.


Este e o quarto empréstimo de Antonio na hluvuku e terceiro com kiva. Esta confiante que vai pagar o empréstimo sem nenhum problema, estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria e fazer a conclusão da sua obra. Os primeiros créditos foram todos para comercio (5.500,00MT; 7.000,00MT e 10.000,00MT). Ele agradece muito a hluvuku e kiva por lhe terem financiado e concretizado o seu grande sonho, pois nos finais deste ano estara a viver em sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Antonio is 25 years old. He was born in Vilanculos in a district of the Inhambane province. He attended school through the 7th grade. He is married and has a 2 year old daughter. Antonio moved out of Vilanculos to search for work with his uncle who lives in Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland. He worked for his uncle for 2 years where he only earned around 150,000MT per month, an amount that didn't cover his expenses. In 2002, Antonio decided to start his own business with money he had saved. He moved out of his uncle's house and rented a place where he still lives for 500,000 MT per month. He is now the owner of a shop that sells electrical appliances (located in the central market of Namaacha). For 7 years his best merchandise has been radios, disks and cellphone rechargers acquired in Maputo for 1,000,000 MT x5, and 35.00MT x50 and resold at 2,200,000MT and 75.00MT respectively. He has earned a profit of 5,000,000 MT and is able to save 1,000,000 MT per month. He supports his two siblings who live with him in his home and he has an employee who earns 1,200,000 MT per month. He is building a house, as he really wants to live in his own home because renting is not at all easy. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his third with Kiva. He is confident that he will pay back the loan without any problem. The 15,000,000 MT will be used to increase his merchandise and finish building his home. The first loans were all for his business (5.500,00 MT; 7.000,00 MT and 10.000,00 MT). He is very grateful to Hluvuku and Kiva for having provided the financing to bring his great dream to reality. At the end of this year he will be able to live in his own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and Sell electrical goods

loans.name: Clarisse Achieng

texts.en:
Clarisse is a 31-year-old shopkeeper. Clarisse runs her shop out of a shipping container in a small town near Kisumu, Kenya. She sells flour, salad, bar soap, sugar, steel wool, tea leaves, milk, and bread, amongst other items. She will use this loan for shop supplies.

In the video, Clarisse tells us about the 9 children that she cares for. She married a man whose first wife had passed away, and left 3 children. Clarisse then has 4 children of her own, and she also cares for her sister’s two children, because her sister passed away. Clarisse’s husband is a painter and has occasional work in the town.

Clarisse hopes to keep her family in good health, and that she can continue to pay school fees for these children. They are all in school now. Clarisse also expressed that her hope is to “raise up the health for the sick in the community”. She is a volunteer community health worker, which means that she visits her sick neighbors on a regular basis, counseling them and their caretakers.

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional micro-finance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Clarisse. For more information about K-MET, click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: buying more goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Shade

texts.en: Shade is 40 years old and married with four children. She owns a computer business center for doing all types of computer jobs. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan  of 80,000 nairas to purchase more computer equipment. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more computer equipment

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no município da vila de namaacha na fronteira da swazilandia tem 40 anos de idade vive maritalmente e é pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 5 e 18 anos encontrando se todos a estudarem.

Eduardo teve que interromper os seus estudos na 7 classe quando foi recrutado para cumprir o Serviço Militar Obrigatório em Zambezia durante 2 anos, apos concluir é afecto para trabalhar como guarda prisional na mesma província durante 10 anos. É transferido para capital maputo, e consegue continuar com os seus estudos e sendo assim promovido, devido ao seu nível, para a categoria de sargento da policia de Moçambique auferindo um salário mensal de 4.109.00MT.
 
Já teve empréstimo no Banco comercial (BIM millennium no valor de 25.000,00MT para inicio da sua obra) que pagou através de debito no salário e quando concluiu não solicitou mais credito devido às condições exigidas que não permitam um rápido desenvolvimento. (prazo obrigatório de 5 anos para pagar o credito).

Em conversa com seu colega que, é cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema, soube da existência e aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00MT para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
 Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa e não consegue poupar nenhum valor devido à construção da sua obra.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novos empréstimos para conclusão da obra, incluindo o murro do seu quintal.
texts.en:
Born in town of Naamacha on the border with Swaziland he is 40 years old and is married. He is the father of 4 children with ages between 5 and 18 years old, all of whom are in school. Eduardo had to interrupt his studies in the 7th grade when he was recruited to complete Mandatory Military Service in Zambezia for 2 years. After finishing this he worked as a prison guard in the same province for 10 years. He was transferred to the capital Maputo and was able to continue with his studies and through promotions, due to his level, rise to the rank of police sergeant of Mozambique earning a monthly salary of 4.109.00MT. He has already had a loan with the Commercial Bank (International Bank of Mozambique with the value of 25.000,00MT to start his project) which he paid by debiting from his salary and when he finished he did not request another loan as the required conditions do not permit rapid development (mandatory terms of 5 years to repay the loan). In a conversation with his colleague who is a client of Hluvuku-Adsema he learned about its existence and approached requesting a loan of the value of 12.000.00MT to continue with the construction if his house. Along with his children, he is responsible for his two nephews who live with him in his house and he is not able to save any money due to the construction of his house. He is confident that he will repay it before the time forecasted and will apply for new loans to finish this project, including a wall around his backyard.

Translated from Portuguese by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Artur Daniel

texts.pt:
Artur Daniel Z. nasceu em inhambane tem 43 anos de idade, e casado e pai de 3 filhos, a primeira de 18 anos, a segunda de 13 anos e o ultimo de 1 ano apenas. Os dois mais velhos é que vão à escola.
Artur quando interrompe os seus estudos na 10 classe devido a grande distancia que o separava de casa a escola onde estudava.
Para alem dos seus filhos Artur responsabiliza se pelos seus dois irmãos que estudam na cidade capital enviando lhes mensalmente um valor de 500.00MT.

 Saiu de inhambane para o município da vila de namaacha na fronteira com swazilandia com seu tio a procura de emprego. Apos sua chegada, começa a trabalhar como servente nos Registo civil do distrito de namaacha onde auferia 1.200.00MT, mas devido ao seu desempenho e força de vontade no trabalho, ele é promovido para categoria de assistente administrativo onde auferir salário no valor de 2.600.00MT trabalhando das 07h30minh as 15h30minh meios de semana e nos finais de semana caso haja casamento das 6h às 10h.

Não é primeira vez que contrai empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema, já teve um empréstimo num Banco Comercial (BIM millennium no valor de 21.000,00MT). Este é quarta vez que contrai empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema e no valor de 10.000,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção. Os primeiros créditos (5.500,00MT; 7.000,00MT e 10.000,00MT) foram também para a mesma actividade. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para ajudar a sua mulher a melhorar os seus negócios.
texts.en:
Artur Daniel Z. was born in Inhambane. He’s 43 years old. He’s married and has three children, an 18-year-old girl, a 13-year-old girl, and a 1-year-old boy. The two oldest are currently going to school. Artur had to drop school when he was 10 due to the large distance that separated his home from the school where he studied. Besides his daughters, Artur is responsible for his two brothers who study in the capital city, sending them around 500.00MT, every month. Artur left Inhambane with his uncle for the Vila de Namaacha municipality, next to the border with Swazilandia to find a job. Soon after he arrived, he found a job as a helper in the Civil Registry of the District of Namaacha, where they offered a salary of 1,200.00MT, but thanks to his hard work and good will towards the job, he was promoted to administrative assistant where they offered a salary of 2,600.00 MT working from 7:30am to 3:30pm on week days and from 6am to 10am on the weekends in case there was a wedding. This is not the first time he requests for a loan from Hluvuku-Adsema, and he also obtained a loan from Banco Comercial (BIM millennium, for 21,000.00MT). This is the fourth time he requests for a loan from Hluvuku-Adsema. He will use the 10,000.00MT, to use to purchase construction material. The first loans (5,500.00MT; 7,000.00MT and 10,000.00MT) we also used for this same activity. He is confident he won’t have any problems paying for this loan, and he also wants to request for a new loan to help his wife to improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon sells automobile spare parts. He is 30 years old and married with a child. He has been in the business for a long time. He hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more automobile spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Adebajo is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells detergent and sugar. A. has been in this business for the past 30 years. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more detergent and sugar to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent and sugar to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata N. est une societaire de la caisse de bayelaye qui est tres experimentee dans le domainede l'aviculture.elle sollicite un credit cinq cent mille (500 000)en vue d'augmenter ses sujets.l'amelioration de ses revenus lui permettra de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familliales.
texts.en:
Aminata N. is a member of the bank of Bayelaye who is very experienced in the domain of poultry farming. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs with the aim of increasing what she has. Increasing her revenues will allow her to support her husband with managing family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en:
Yetunde lives in Lagos State and she is 40 years old and married with two children. Yetunde sells drinks and wine, and she is also a stylist in her house. She has been in the business for the past ten years.

Yetunde has been borrowing from LAPO for the past year. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more drinks, wine and juice to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Shu

texts.en: Married with two kids below the age of fifteen is G.. He is in his late thirties and he lives in Ntasen, Bamenda, Cameroon. G. was motivated to become a GHAPE member in 2003 when GHAPE extended its activities to his neighborhood in Ntasen. He saw this as an opportunity to make something out of his life. Since then he has taken and repaid four successive loans, each one higher than the previous. He even was and is able to cater for his family like in paying bills and planning for the future from the savings he made from his loan activities. G. has been through some difficulties in the thick and thin of life. He was and is still up to the task. He has resolved a lot of challenges in life such as the death of his mother and brother in 1982 and 2007 respectively. G. plans to invest his fourth loan in a bamboo business. More specifically he will buy bamboo in bulk and then retail it. He has a longstanding experience in this business. G. lives a few meters from the major market in the area. The profit from his business activities will be used for the education and welfare of his family members. His community stands to benefit from his activities in that they will not have to go as far or wait until market day to get what they want. He will also sell at a reasonable price because he prefers a quick turnover over a longer period of time rather than a higher profit margin. G. loves GHAPE because of the low interest rate and the social interactions among members. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo to sell

loans.name: Mankah

texts.en: P. is a 56-year-old mother of three. She has been a GHAPE member since the very beginning of the organization and is now looking to take out her 9th loan from the organization. With this last loan, she is looking to expand her provision store, and she is hoping that she will be able to sell fruit and other foodstuffs in addition to the regular things to be found in a provision store, such as candles, soap, drinks, and dried goods. P. is sure that this expansion will be a success not only because of the larger selection of things that she will be able to offer to her customers, but also because of the loyal base of customers that she has as well as the experience that she has in running such a business. Because of this experience, she has been able to pick out a good business location, and has also been able to see that there is a much larger profit margin in selling fruit, as compared to other produce items. This growth will benefit the community in that people will be able to have access to more nutritious food at any time that they would want to purchase it, and also because of the practices that P. has learned over time that aid in building her business. With the profits of this venture, P. will be able to afford the drugs that she needs to stay healthy, and she will also be able to pay her grandchildren’s school fees. In addition to this, she will be able to pay her rent and reinvest in expanding her business. Patrica originally came to GHAPE because of the long term repayment, lack of collateral and low rents. But since that time, she has found use in their training programs for business development, and also because of the follow up that GHAPE credit assistants and community members make to be able to be sure that people’s businesses are succeeding and that they are getting all the help that they need to be able to stay successful into the future.
