About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To expand her provision store

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a mother of nine living in Mile 90, a community just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. Living there, she has been able to take out five separate loans from GHAPE to be able to expand her farming practices, and also open up her own grocery store. 

With this next loan that she is applying for, Magdaline hopes to be able to grow her store, and also support her pig farming practices, a very profitable venture in this area. 

She is sure that these activities will be a success because of her prior experience in this business, and also because of the variety of products that she is able to carry in her store. This variety gives people more choices of what to buy, and it attracts them to her business as opposed to others, because of the sheer volume of what she is able to put out for sale in the store.

With the profits of this business, she will be able to continue to support the education and apprenticeship of her children in learning different skills and making their own lives more fruitful because of the empowerment that they have received. Magdaline also plans to put the money that she makes back into the business. 

Through the credit and the trainings that she has received, Magdaline has been able to make a notable difference in the life of her family members, and also in the conditions that they are subject to on a daily basis. She originally came to GHAPE because of the low interest rate, but now continues to stay with the organization because of the non-monetary gains that she has received. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and seedlings to support her farming practice, and purchase of items to grow her grocery store

loans.name: Jireth Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jireth  lo  conforman tres mujeres beligerantes, trabajadoras, con visión  y muy capaces  estas son Midred Alejandra G. Velázquez,  María Cristina M. M. y María José T. O.. Ellas son provenientes del municipio de Nindirí, Masaya  donde las labores artesanales como la producción de muebles, hamacas, cerámica y canastos constituyen actividades productivas importantes para su desarrollo.

       Además Masaya es la cuna del folklor, el arte y las artesanías nicaragüenses y cuenta con el Mercado de Artesanía y Mercado municipal.

       La coordinadora del grupo es Midred G. de 27 años de edad  que desde hace diez años trabaja con artesanías. Ella comenzó en este negocio desde muy pequeña  trabajando  junto con su  madre y su hermana menor,  actualmente G. administra un tramo de artesanía que le heredo su madre  donde vende artesanías  propias y de otras artesanas.

       Esta joven necesita capital para poder costear su producción de collares, pulseras, chapas y trusas (camisetas, pantalones) entre otras artes manuales que realiza.

       Las otras integrantes del grupo son  María Cristina M. quien trabaja en la alcaldía de Masaya y a tiende un pequeño negocio de distribución de huevos  junto con su compañero de vida. Mientras María José T. O. vende ropa en la comunidad donde habitan.

       Todas ellas desean salir adelante y seguir trabajando, pero para ello necesitan invertir en la adquisición de productos para sus respectivos negocios con el cual ellas no cuentan.
texts.en:
The JIRETH group is made up of three pugnacious, hard-working, very capable women with vision. They are Midred Alejandra G. Velázquez, María Cristina M. M., and María José T. Obanda. They come from the municipality of Nindirí, Masaya, where handicrafts like the production of furniture, hammocks, ceramics, and baskets constitute important productive activities for their development. Moreover, Masaya is the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore, art, and handicrafts, and features the Craft Market and the Municipal Market. The coordinator of the group is Midred G., 27, who has worked in craftwork for 10 years. She started in this business when she was very young, working alongside her mother and her younger sister. Currently, G. manages a stretch of craftwork that she inherited from her mother, where she sells her own craftwork as well as others' work. This young woman needs capital to be able to finance her production of necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and clothing (shirts, trousers) among other manual craftwork that she carries out. The other members of the group are María Cristina M., who works in the mayor's office in Masaya and also owns a small business distributing eggs, together with her partner. María José T. Obanda sells clothes in the community. All of them want to prosper and continue working, but they need to invest in the acquisition of products for their respective businesses in order to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for craftwork

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa T. W. is a 65-year-old father of eight. He has been with GHAPE since 1999, and has been able to take out nine separate loans to be able to support his pig and fowl raising activities. For the first time, T. is looking to start another business as a motorcycle taxi driver, a rather profitable business in the area.

T. will use this motorcycle to take community members throughout the area to and from their homes and places of business, and will also aid in taking their produce to market. This activity is sure to succeed, T. thinks, because he will be the driver of this bike himself, rather than paying other people to take care of the machine and drive people around. With this being the case, he will be riding the bike more carefully than other people, working harder, while also being able to cut down on the maintenance needs of the bike. 

As he generates profits from this activity, T. will be using the money to invest in the education of his children, and also to improve on his family's living conditions. 

Originally coming to GHAPE, T. saw that they were one of the best options for providing credit in the area, as they have lower interest rates, more agreeable terms on their loans, and a payment plan that is not very stressful. In addition to this, T. has been able to enjoy GHAPE training on how to manage his business, his money, and also on how to operate in his family life and day to day dealings with other people.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle, documentation and licensing

loans.name: Nafisah

texts.en: Nafisah is 48 years old. She is a wife and mother of four children who are currently in school. She sells charcoal in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Nafisah obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and resells it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of charcoal to increase her stock. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: ibrahima S. est membre de la caisse de bayelaye guediawaye depuis 2007.il capitalise sept ans d'experience dans son activite.il gere une quincaillerie dans sa zone d'habitation.il est marie et pere de famille .donc avec l'augmentation de ses revenus a travers l'accroissement de sa marge beneficiaire il souhaite ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibrahima S. has been a member of the bank of Bayelaye Guediawaye since 2007. He capitalizes on seven years of experience in his business. He manages a hardware store in the area where he lives. He is married and a family man. Thus, with the increase in his revenues by growing his profit margin, he wishes to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital for commerce

loans.name: Mojisola

texts.en: Mojisola lives in Lagos. She rents DVDs and also sells frozen food like turkey and chicken. She has been in business for the past five years. Mojisola has been borrowing from lapo for the past two years and she has been investing the loan in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more DVDs and frozen food like chicken and turkey to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Dennis Julian

texts.es: Dennis Julián Hernández A. tiene 43 años de edad. Su estado civil es soltero. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su compañera de vida cuida a sus hijos. Su actividad económica es joyería. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, ya que es aquí donde obtenido la mayoría de sus clientes. Sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio para el beneficio de su familia ya que de esto depende la manutención de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de oro, plata, piedras y algunos ácidos. Sus deseos para el futuro son de que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dennis Julián Hernández A. is a 43-year old single father of three. His life partner takes care of his children. He is a jeweler and has done it for a living for more than five years. His business is located outside a marketplace, which is where he has obtained the majority of his customers. His intention is to expand his business to benefit his family, which is dependent on his income. He is asking for financing to buy gold, silver, stones, and acids. His goal for the future is that his children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is the mother of three children and is a fish monger in Alabukam where she lives and operates her business. She will use this loan to purchase flour and fish, as well as to cover transportation and rent costs.   
 
This is Mercy’s third loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. Mercy trusts her business will be a successful one because she thinks she has a good site at which she operates her business. Her customer base is also consistent and Mercy is skillful in her activities. 

Like most entrepreneurial mothers, Mercy plans to use the profits from the loans to pay for her children’s school fees. The profits will also go towards purchasing food and clothing for the family. Mercy enjoys being a GHAPE member and likes the group of entrepreneurs she works with. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and flour

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es: Magdalena del Carmen Pérez J. tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solamente 2 están a su cargo. Ella tiene muchos propósitos en su vida, por lo que uno de ellos es ampliar su negocio para obtener más clientes. La actividad económica de Magdalena es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad económica. Ella dio inicio porque tenía que alimentar a sus hijos y proporcionarles estudios, es por eso que inicio con la venta de frijoles cocidos y leña. Pero necesitaba un negocio que le brindara mucho más ingresos, y decide incursionar en la venta de mercadería en general. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, bolsos, calzado y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Magdalena del Carmen Pérez J. has six children but only two currently in her care. She has many goals in her life, one of which is to gain more clients.

She works selling various merchandise. She has dedicated herself to this modest business for over six years. Because she needed to feed her children and provide for their studies, she started selling cooked beans and firewood. But because she needed a business that provided a greater income she decided to sell other merchandise as well.

Her reason for the loan is that she wants to buy shirts, bags, shoes, and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shirts, shoes, bags, and underwear

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De (Benkadi A  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI  2 de l’association BENKADI A   est  constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Ce prêt servira à  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 25 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés du village de Marka-Coungo et Fana  après les récoltes et à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant très généralement des grandes villes telles Bamako, Ségou. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI 2 of the association BENKADI A is composed of married women who average 44 years of age and 4 children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the community seat of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work.  Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts.  The group members are on their fifth loan with the institution.  All the past loans were repaid without difficulty. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment.  And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 25 hectares.  Part of their production is consumed at home.  The other part is sold to customers composed of men and women generally from big cities, such as Bamako and Ségou.  The goods are sold at the weekly markets of Marka-Coungo and Fana after the harvests.  The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Alambiri

texts.en:
Alambiri is forty years old and is married with five children, who are currently in school.

Alambiri is a taxi driver and has been driving for the past fifteen years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks up passengers from the local lorry (truck) stations and takes them to the nearby towns at a fare of 50 pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head. Through this business he has managed to raise enough capital to support his wife’s business.

Alambiri requests the loan to enable him to maintain his taxi to resume his business to make income to support his family and get his kids back to school. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en:
Romoke lives in Lagos State. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children.

Romoke sells drinks and herbs (native medicines) and has been in her business for the past eight years. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years and the loans have been a source of capital to her business.

Romoke is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more drinks and herbs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and herbs to sell

loans.name: Ngang

texts.en:
Ngang P. is a father of five and widower of two separate wives. All the way back in 1998, P. joined GHAPE to be able to provide his family with a brighter future. He received training from our organization and has also invested in farming and pig rearing. 

Coming back to our organization, P. is looking for a loan to be able to start a firewood selling business. In this area, it is very common for people to use fires rather than stoves for their cooking, and P. sees that there is much need for greater access to this resource. That being the case, P. is looking to buy a hammer, chisel, axe and wood to be able to distribute his firewood throughout the community. 

With his past loan activity, P. invested the gains in educating his children, improving his home, buying piglets for his farm, and for trading in his community. This next loan will also be used for some of the same purposes. P. would like to continue his children’s education and ensure their good health, and he would also like continue improving his home, being able to plaster the walls of his house. He is sure that this business will succeed because of the large market demand and because of his ability to sell the wood at a reasonable price.

P. originally came to GHAPE because of the reasonable rates on the loans and also because of what he has gotten out of them. He has learned how to manage his money, how to run a profitable farm, and has also learned about how to educate his children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of hammer, chisel, axe, firewood, transport of materials

loans.name: Lesbia Mercedes

texts.es: Lesbia Mercedes R. Carrión tiene 45 años. Es una mujer casada. Ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que desde muy joven ha trabajado. Y fue su Mama quien le enseño esta actividad económica  y agradece mucho porque fue el único medio de vida que encontró para obtener ingresos humildemente. A pesar de enfrentar desafíos como mantener el negocio en estos días tan difíciles. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, vestidos.
texts.en:
Lesbia Mercedes R. Carrión is 45 years old and a married woman. She has one child left at home. Her business is buying and selling new clothing. She has been doing this for more than ten years.

She is a very hardworking woman and she has been working since she was very young. It was her mother that taught her the business and is very thankful that the only way of life she knows is working hard for her modest income. In spite of facing challenges like keeping her business running in these difficult times she continues to work.

She needs the loan in order to buy shirts, pants, and vests.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shirts, pants, and vests

loans.name: Tamidayo

texts.en: Tamidayo sells drinks, sachet water and palm oil in her house. She has been in business for the past ten years. Tamidayo lives in Lagos and she is very happy with lapo and Kiva for their financial support. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and palm oil to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  2  De (Benkadi  B  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 de l’association BENKADI B sont tous des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE, un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et tous les précédents  ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 24 hectares.
Après la récolte, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue, sur place au village, dans le marché de Marka-Coungo et à Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 of the association BENKADI B are all married women who average 36 years of age and 4 children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a leading community of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work.  Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts.  They are on their fifth loan with the institution.  All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment.  And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 24 hectares.  After the harvest, part of their production is consumed at home.  The other part is sold locally in town to customers composed of men and women at the marketplace of Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 51-year-old father of seven. He joined GHAPE all the way back in 1998, when the organization was founded. Since that time, he has been able to take out eight separate loans to be able to develop his farm, purchase a motorbike, and also to pay for renovating his house and sending his children to school. 

In his life, Moses has been able to overcome many different obstacles, from the death of his first wife to his political imprisonment in the wake of the strikes that occurred in Cameroon in 2008.In spite of this all however, Moses has been able to develop his businesses and provide his children with more opportunity than he was ever afforded.

With his next loan, Moses hopes to be able to purchase a motorbike, fund the necessary documentation, and also be able to sponsor a driver in the short term, with these arrangements being made.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike, licensing, documentation

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señora Mirna esta separada del esposo, vive en anticrético con sus hijos en la calle Bolívar de la zona Ernesto Torrez de la ciudad de La Paz; para mantener a su familia ella se dedica al tejido y bordado de chompas, con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir sus mínimas necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para comprar lana que es su principal insumo. 

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien, también fue parte de Kiva y por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirna is separated from her husband. She lives in a rental property with her children on Bolivar Street, in the Ernesto Torrez section of the city of La Paz. In order to support her family, she weaves and embroiders sweaters. This business allows her to cover her family’s living expenses and their basic necessities.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wool since that is the primary material she uses. Sra. Mirna was a former client of IMPRO and had a good payment history. She was also on Kiva and her good character qualifies her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es: Vida Luz R. M. tiene la edad de 31 años. Es una mujer casada. Doña Vida tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Por lo que sus principales propósitos son de ampliar su negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de video juegos. La ubicación de su negocio en su vivienda. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mantener al día sus pagos. Por lo que en este momento requiere del financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de nuevos discos de juegos, controles y proporcionarle mantenimiento a sus televisores. En sus deseos esta obtener otro medio de ingreso para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Vida Luz R. M., 31, is married and has two dependent children. Her primary objective is to expand her business to be able to give her children the necessary education. Her business is offering the services of video games. Her business is located in her house. She has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has always been careful to make her payments on time. She now needs a loan for working capital to buy new video game discs, controls, and to perform maintenance on her televisions. Her dream is to get another means of income to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario vive en casa propia con su esposo en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja como mecánico  y ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la misma casa; con los ingresos que tienen de ambas actividades pueden cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades. El crédito que solicitan es para surtir su tienda y poder tener mayor clientela de esta manera estabilizar sus ingresos ya que ellos son personas de la tercera edad y no tienen mas actividades.

Son clientes de Impro y pagaron muy bien por lo tanto pueden acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rosario lives with her husband in her own house on Manuel Josfre Street in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a mechanic. She has a grocery store in her house. With both incomes they can cover their barest necessities. The loan she is asking for is to stock her store in order to have more customers. This will stabilize her income. They are in their old age, and they do not have other income producing activities. They are clients of Impro. They make their payments very well, so they qualify for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
El señor Jacinto vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Feliciano Kantuta de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz y trabaja con la venta de movilidades a medio uso, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para reparar algunas fallas del auto que compró ultimamente para venderlo en buenas condiciones y de esta manera mantener su negocio estable


Ya fue cliente de Impro y pagó muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Jacinto lives in his own home with his wife and children on Feliciano Kantuta Street in the Tacagua section of the city of La Paz. He sells used vehicles in order to support his family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to make minor repairs to an automobile that he will sell in good condition. This will keep his business operating. He was a previous client of IMPRO with a good payment history, and as a result, he is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a vehicle that he will resell

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia C. E. tiene 53 años. Es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos. Que ya no dependen de ella. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue una necesidad para proveerles a sus hijos el alimento y vestimento diario. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Por lo que lucho muy duro para alcanzar lo que ha logrado hasta los momentos con su actividad económica, con estos ingresos ha podido sufragar los gastos de su familia y le proporcionado lo necesario a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y  gaseosas. Su meta es expandir su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Eugenia C. E. is 53 years old. She is the single mother of 3 children, who are no longer dependent on her. For more than 5 years she has worked in her business; it was necessary to provide her children daily food and cloths. She runs a general store. Because she fought hard to reach her achievements in business, she has been able to meet the family costs with her profits, and provide for the basic needs of her children. The loan that she is requesting is for working capitol to buy candy, juice, bread, and soda. Her dream is to expand her business to improve her quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capitol

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria vive con su esposo e hijos en anticretico en la calle Atahuallpa de la zona de San Sebastian de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como enfermera en el hospital, con estos ingresos ella mantiene a su familia; el crédito que solicita es para un chequeo de su salud, ya que el seguro en nuestro País es muy deficiente y es necesario ser atendido en clínicas particulares

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria lives with her husband and children in a rental property on Atahuallpa Street in the San Sebastian area of the city of La Paz. She works as a nurse at a hospital and is able to support her family with her earnings.

She is requesting a loan to pay for a health checkup because the national insurance is not adequate and she wants to be seen at a private clinic.

Sra. Ana Maria was a previous IMPRO client with a good payment history, so she is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a health checkup

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is 28 years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter, who are currently in primary school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town. She trades in cosmetics. Alberta sells cosmetics such as powder, assorted body and hair creams, perfumes, etc. She hawks to sell her cosmetics in her community. Aside from her cosmetics business, she also sells gari and palm oil on a table top at her residence. Alberta buys her goods from the central market in Accra. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Alberta aspires to expand her business so that she can depend on her proceeds in taking care of the family.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Xiomara Mercedes

texts.es: Xiomara Mercedes C. B. tiene  40 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella dio inicio a esta humilde actividad económica trabajando en el mercado por lo que a pesar de que tenía el apoyo de su familia, pero el mayor desafío que atravesó fue dejar a sus hijos, por ella tenía que levantarse muy temprano ya que necesitaba ayudar con los gastos de la familia y además proporcionarles estudios a sus hijos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y a pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado ha salido adelante. En esta oportunidad solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, calzado, ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Su mayor deseo es proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Xiomara Mercedes C. B. is 40 years old and has 3 children. She started her modest business selling general merchandise in order to support her family. The biggest challenge she has to go through is leaving her children, since she leaves very early so that she can help with the family expenses and pay for her children’s education.

She has been in business for 10 years and has been able to move forward despite some difficulties. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy handbags, shoes, and clothing for children, women and men. Her greatest hope is to provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de la Paz, trabaja en un imprenta, con este trabajo el mantiene a su familia pero no le alcanza para pagar los estudios de sus hijos motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo para poder pagarlo poco a poco y de esta manera pagar la educación de sus hijos.

Ya fue cliente de Impro y pagó muy bien, puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo lives in his own house with his wife and children on 4 de Mayo (4th of May) Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area of the city of La Paz. He works at a printer’s press, and with this work he supports his family, but he is not able to pay for the studies of his children. Motivated by this, he is asking for a loan to be able to pay little by little and in this way pay for the education of his children.

He is already a client of Impro and has paid reliably, and can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en alquiler, en la calle Cumana de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, dentro de la misma casa tiene un horno alquilado donde se dedica a la elaboración de pan, empanadas, yemitas y macitas en general, en esta actividad ella trabaja junto con su familia y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina elaboradora de pan y de esta manera mantener estable su fuente de ingresos de ella y de su familia


Ya fue cliente de Impro y pagó muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha lives in a rental property on Cumana Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. In her home, she has a rented oven that she uses to make bread, empanadas, yemitas (sweets made by boiling sugar and egg yolks, which are covered in syrup when cooled), and cookies. Her family works with her in this business.

Sra. Martha is requesting a loan to buy a bread making machine, which will help maintain a stable income for her and her family. She was a previous IMPRO client with a good payment history, so she is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine for making bread & pastry dough

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a 32-year-old trader. She is married with three children: two boys and a girl. All her children are currently in school.

Georgina sells used clothes in a community market of Accra where she lives. She also sells on credit to students in the universities. She sometimes sells through hawking (going door-to-door) when business is slow in the market center.

With low capital, Georgina is not able to buy larger bales of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase her stock with more variety.

Georgina hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Benkadi 3  De (Benkadi A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans  et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles  achèteront de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 26  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés de  Marka-Coungo et Fana,  après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Benkadi 3 of the BENKADI A association are married women with an average age of 38 years old and 3 children. For the most part, these women live in polygamous marriages in Tingole, the capital of a rural commune under the prefecture of Fana, the second administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to get financial support for their winter labors. Largely, their labor surrounds the cultivation of sorgho and peanuts. This is their fifth loan from the institution and all of their previous loans were completely repaid on time. With this new loan they will purchase fertilizer, pesticides, other basic tools, and pay the hoeing and labor fees that are required to cultivate 26 hectares. Some of their cultivation is shared among the group members for personal consumption and the rest is sold in the Marka-Coungo and Fana markets after the harvest to male and female clients. They believe that they will make an average profit of 30 000FCFA after the harvest and sale of their crops.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, pesticides, hoeing and basic tools

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela vive en alquiler en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, convive con su pareja el cual trabaja en una imprenta; ella trabaja como ayudante de cocina y los ingresos que perciben son muy bajos por lo tanto iniciaron un negocio de venta de víveres (arroz, azucar, harina, etc.), y el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y continuar con el negocio y hacerlo mas estable.

No fue un cliente de Impro anteriormente, pero por la actividad y el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabriela lives in a rental property on May 4 Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. She lives with her common law partner, who works in a print shop. Sra. Gabriela works as a kitchen assistant. Since her income is not sufficient, she decided to start a business selling food (rice, sugar, flour, etc.). The loan she is requesting will be used augment her capital and continue her business so that it remains stable. She had not worked with IMPRO previously, but her business activity and character enabled her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products for her retail store

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto García tiene 45 años. Vive en su propia casa. En un hombre muy luchador que le gusta mucho el trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de salón de belleza. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que el inicia desde muy joven ya que no tenía un medio de ingresos para su familia, el un hombre responsable y disfruta mucho su trabajo ya que muchos clientes conversan con él mientras realiza su trabajo. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ciertos productos para su salon. El sueño de Jorge es poder mantener su actividad económica para brindar a sus clientes una excelente atención.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto García is 45 years old and lives in his own home. He is a hardworking gentleman who enjoys his job. He offers personal grooming services at a beauty salon and has been in business for more than 16 years. He started working at a young age because his family did not have much money. Sr. Jorge is a responsible person. He likes his work so much because he has many customers who chat with him while he is working.

He is requesting a loan is to purchase products for his salon. His dream is to continue his business and provide his clients with excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Zenelia

texts.es: Zenelia L. M. tiene 51 años. Ella es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de cosmético. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a su negocio. Su mayor desafío que enfrento con este negocio fue aprender ofrecer a sus clientes sus productos, ya que no tenía la suficiente experiencia para hablar fácilmente con sus clientes, además es una mujer que ha sufrido ciertas enfermedades. Pero esto no le es imposible salir adelante. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas faciales, pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, brillos y cremas. Su mayor deseo es tener más clientes para su incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
Zenelia L. M. is 51 years old. She is a single mother. She has 2 children in her care. Her work is the sale of cosmetics. She has worked for more than 2 years at this business. The greatest challenge that she faces with this business was to learn to offer her clients her products, and she didn’t have sufficient experience to speak easily with her clients. Also, she is a woman who has suffered certain illnesses. But with that, it is not impossible for her to move her life forward. She is asking for the loan for working funds in order to buy facial creams, eyeliner, eye shadow, nail polish, and creams. Her greatest desire is to have more clients in order to grow her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Esperanza Divina Group

texts.en:
Dorka is the group leader of Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope). At the young age of 23, she is already an enterprising young woman who sells new clothes. She goes from town to town selling clothes that she buys for a good price in the capital, Santo Domingo.

With this loan, she will buy more blouses and pants in the capital. She hopes that with more inventory and more options for her clients, she will be able to sell more and make a higher profit. She has two children, ages 6 and 3 months, and she hopes that with growth in her business she will be able to better provide for them. Her goal is to one day be able to open up her own store downtown.

Please consider funding Dorka´s loans and giving her the chance to achieve her dreams!

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Servio

texts.es: Servio C. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 40 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar duro para sacar a su familia adelante, por lo que comenzó a vender bolsitas y refrescos naturales por lo que sus clientes le solicitaban más productos y así decide incursionar en este negocio. Y así empieza con este humilde negocio. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, pan, galletas y un poco de granos básicos. Uno de los mayores desafíos que enfrento fue satisfacer a sus clientes. Sus sueños son de establecer otro negocio como una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Servio C. Rodríguez is 40 years old. He is a married man and he has two children in his care. His work is a grocery store. He has dedicated more than 6 years to this business. He is a very hardworking man, as he has always liked working hard in order to improve his family’s lives. For this reason he began to sell snacks and natural drinks, until his clients ask him for more products and he decided to begin this business. And so he began with this humble business. The loan that he is asking for is for the purchase of sweets, juices, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and a few basic grains. One of the greatest challenges that he faced was to satisfy his clients. His dreams are to establish another business, as a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a forty-eight-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children who are all in school. She is a serious-minded businesswoman who works hard to support her husband in providing for her family.

Georgina owns and operates a grocery shop and a clothing store in the local market in her neighborhood. She sells grocery items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar and cartons of vegetable oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Georgina hopes to increase her income by adding on the sale of cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar and cartons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es: Senovia  está solicitando  su 8vo  refinanciamiento  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en la Escuela Diriangen desde hace 20 años, esta clienta tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de  17 años de edad estudia su quinto año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 14 años estudia su tercer año de Educación secundaria,  esta clienta se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesta, trabajadora, su esposo es comerciante el cual viaja a las colonias del Municipio de Nueva Guinea a comprar ganado con un hermano,  ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos pero bien unida, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 2 años y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, viven  en la colonia San Antonio en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que estos van adquiriendo con AFODENIC, tener estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Senovia is asking for her 8th loan in order to invest in improving her manner of living (constructing a room). She has worked as a docent in the Diriangen School for 20 years. This client has two children. The eldest is 17 years old, or of school age, and is in his fifth year of secondary education. The younger daughter is 14 years old, and she is in her third year of secondary education. This client is known for being responsible, honest, and hardworking. Her husband is a businessmen who travels to the area of the Municipality Nueva Guinea to buy livestock with a brother. They share the family’s household expenses, and they are a family of few resources but they are very tight-knit. This loan would be repaid in two years and so little by little to go on improving their home. They live in the area San Antonio in a neighbourhood where each day the population is increasing. Her dream is to go on improving her home with each loan that they get with AFODENIC, to have work stability, health, and that her children continue studying so that they may do something with their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha M. tiene 54 años. Es una mujer casada tiene 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de  frutas y verduras. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que desde muy joven le gustaba relacionarse con todo tipo de personas, ya que ofrece sus productos en comarcas y obtiene muchos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de tomates, cebollas, naranjas, repollo entre otras verduras. El deseo de Martha es proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio y a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha M. is 54 years old, married, and has 4 dependent children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 13 years. Sra. Martha is a hardworking woman who, from a young age, has enjoyed interacting with all types of people. She offers regional products and has obtained many customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, cabbages and other vegetables. She hopes to make improvements to her business and her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Doña Marlene está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de un pantri), trabaja como  conserje en el INTA  desde hace 12 años, tiene una hijo de 14 años de edad la cual esta estudiando su primer año  de Educación secundaria,  a pesar que doña Marlene a cuidado de su hijo sola sin la ayuda del padre de su hijo, ella ha luchado para que no le falte nada, ella se caracteriza por ser honesta, servivicial  con el que lo necesita y muy trabajadora,  vive en un barrio de la zona urbana , su sueño es tener mucha salud para trabajar y luchar por un porvenir mejor para ver a su hijo estudiar y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Doña Marlene is requesting her 7th loan to be used for home improvements (construction of a kitchen). She has worked as a janitor at INTA for 12 years. She has a 14 year old son who in his first year of high school. Despite the fact that she has raised her child without the help of his father, Doña Marlene has not lacked anything even though she has had to struggle at times. She is characterized by her honesty, willingness to help, and hard work. She lives in an urban neighborhood. Her dream is to have good health so that she can work, fight for a better future for her child, and succeed in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kitchen

loans.name: El Buen Futuro Group 5

texts.en:
Antonia S. is the group leader of El Buen Futuro (a Good Future) Group. She has been selling new clothes for many years and loves helping people shop and giving people fashion advice. Four years ago, she started taking out micro-loans to grow her business. Since then, she has seen great success and has been able to sell much more. Her success even allowed her to send one of her children to college. 

Now she is seeking another loan to buy more pants to grow her business even more. Right now, she sells clothes from her house but her dream is to one day open up a store downtown. 

By helping to fund this loan you can help Antonia and all her group members come one step closer to achieving their dreams!

loans.use: Buy more pants

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Por un futuro mejor esta ubicado en el mercado centrar del Cantón Paute, Paute es un lugar turístico de la provincia del Azuay, se caracteriza por su clima tropical, los espacios verdes, plantaciones de flores y frutas, sembríos de caña de azúcar y variedad de frutas que producen sus habitantes, las integrantes del banquito son comerciantes en el mercado de diferentes productos como frutas, legumbres, variedad de carnes, comida, entre otros.
Las personas en este sector son muy amables y respetuosas, son organizadas y colaboradoras es así:

Mercedes tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive en unión libre con su pareja, el hijo mayor estudia en el colegio de Paute, Mercedes por falta de recursos económicos tiene instrucción solo primaria, en cambio su pareja tiene hasta dos años de universidad, en su casa viven 6 personas, las cuales colaboran en el negocio, tanto hijos como pareja trabajan con ella y esta agradecida con Dios por tener una familia así.
Mercedes se dedica a la panadería hace ya mucho tiempo, más o menos unos 7 años, el crédito que solicitó es de 330 dólares para invertir en su negocio, su horario de trabajo es de 11 a 12 horas diarias, los 5 días a la semana, cuenta que más o menos gana unos 20 dólares semanal en el pan ya que no hace mucho porque en ocasiones a tenido que quedarse con el pan que no se vende, esto es por la competencia, este es su primer crédito que realiza a la Fundación ESPOIR, la invitaron unas amigas del grupo, su meta en el futuro es poderse pone su propia panadería ya que por el momento esta haciendo en su propia casa y sueña con tener un local para poder comercializar el pan conjuntamente con tortas, pastas, postres y demás delicias que Mercedes sabe hacer. 

María es oriunda de la ciudad de Cuenca, vive por el barrio de San José de Balsay, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, se dedica al comercio de pollos pelados, por libras y enteros, vende aproximadamente 25 pollos diarios en el mercado central de Paute, pero los días feriados su venta se duplica, estos días son los miércoles y domingos, su horario de trabajo es de 9 de la mañana hasta máximo las 3 de la tarde, de lunes a Domingo, su crédito que realizó es de 330 dólares,  que invertirá en comprar pollos bebes para criarlos y tener más utilidad al momento de venderlos, es socia ya mucho tiempo pero hace un año se retiro por causa de la distancia ya que pertenecía a otro banco que quedaba en Cuenca y la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en Paute, su meta es poder tener un criadero grande de pollo y adquirir equipos para poder pelarlos ella misma.

Diana es nativa de el cantón Paute, sector el barrio la Solidaridad, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera se encuentra embarazada de 7 meses de gestación, tiene instrucción secundaria hasta 4º curso, se retiro por causa de su embarazo y por la situación económica, vive con sus padres y aporta económicamente en los gastos diarios, se dedica al comercio informal en la venta de dulces dentro y fuera del mercado, ya tiene más o menos unos dos años trabajando de esta manera, en la semana gana aproximadamente 20 dólares, piensa seguir estudiando pero luego que nazca su niño, el crédito que realizó es de 220 dólares y lo va a utilizar para invertir en su negocio que es de rosquillas, tortas, entre otros. Su meta en la vida es poder terminar los estudios en el colegio y seguir en la universidad estudiando marketing y finanzas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Por un futuro mejor” (For a Better Future) is located in the center of the Paute District. Paute is a tourist area in the province of Azuay, characterized by its tropical climate, green spaces, plantations, sugar cane fields and a variety of fruit produced by its inhabitants. The members of the communal bank are business owners who sell different products in the market such as fruit, vegetables, meats, prepared meals, and other items. These women are very kind, respectful, organized, and they work well with one another.

Mercedes is 45 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. Her oldest child attends high school in Paute. Mercedes could only afford to finish elementary school, in contrast to her partner who completed two years of college. Living in a house full of people who are willing to work and help with her business, she is thankful to God for the family that she has. Mercedes has been working at her bakery for quite some time, approximately 7 years. Her loan of $330 will be invested into her business. She works a schedule of 11-12 hours, 5 days a week. Mercedes earns about $20 each week selling bread, which helps tremendously because her family gets to keep the bread that is not sold as a result of competition. This is her first loan with Fundación ESPOIR. She was invited by her friends to join the group. Her goal for the future is to acquire a location for her bakery since she currently makes bread from home. Mercedes says this will help her to market her bread, along with cakes, pastries, desserts and other delicacies.

María is a native of Cuenca and lives in the neighborhood of San José de Balsay. She is 44 years old, married, and has 6 children. Her business involves selling whole plucked chickens by the pound. She sells approximately 25 chickens each day at the Paute central market. Her sales double during the holidays, and also on Wednesdays and Sundays. Her work schedule is from 9am to 3pm, Monday through Sunday. She will use her loan of $330 to purchase chicks and raise them until they are ready for sale. María is a longtime member, but became inactive for a year because of the distance and her decision to work with another group based in Cuenca. Her goal is to own a large chicken hatchery and purchase equipment for plucking.

Diana is a native of Paute and lives in the neighborhood of Solidaridad. She is 21 years old, single, and 7 months pregnant. Diana completed her education prior to the 4th year of high school before she dropped out because of her pregnancy and for financial reasons. She lives with her parents and contributes to the daily expenses. She has an informal business selling candy in the market and at other locations. Her business has been in operation for about 2 years and she earns approximately $20 each week. She plans to continue her studies after the birth of her child. She will use her loan of $220 to purchase donuts, cakes, and other items for her business. Her goal in life is to complete high school and continue on to college to study either marketing or finance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens for breeding, expand a bakery business, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 24 years old. She is married with two children. She owns and operates a grocery shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. 

She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children's education. She loves her work so much, making her an admired trader in her community. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Briceida Urania

texts.es: Briceida Urania R. González tiene 62 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de de proporcionar el sustento diario, ella recorre muchos lugares en busca de nuevos clientes y además siempre camina con una sonrisa en su rostro, a pesar del cansancio que lleva consigo no le impide interactuar con sus clientes. Ellos siempre solicitan nuevos productos, y tallas extra grandes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, camisetas, tallas extra grandes y vestidos. Su mayor sueño a cumplir es  obtener otro negocio como es una pulpería.
texts.en:
Briceida Urania R. González is 62 years old. She has been in business for more than 7 years selling new and used clothing. Sra. Briceida started her business out of necessity in order to meet her daily expenses. She goes everywhere in search of new clients and can always been seen with a smile on her face. Even though her work tires her out, it never stops her from interacting with her customers.

She is always looking for new products, especially items in extra large sizes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shirts, pants, skirts, undershirts, dresses, and extra large garments. Her biggest dream is to open another business, such as a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ercilia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Ercilla es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas, un grupo grande de mujeres que se reúne cada dos semanas en la oficina de Espoir en Jipijapa, una pequeña ciudad en la costa ecuatoriana. Es una señora muy encantadora y simpática, le gusta mucho conversar con la gente. Ella vive en unión libre con su pareja; ella tenía dos hijos, pero lamentablemente su hija falleció entonces solamente tiene un hijo de 16 años ahora. Su hijo esta terminando sus estudios de colegio en este momento, y quiere seguir con sus estudios para poder ser medico en el futuro, entonces actualmente ella está viendo si sería posible mandarle a la escuela de medicina en Guayaquil. Su esposo es radiotécnico; se dedica a la reparación de computadores, televisores y radios. A veces hay negocio y a veces no, y últimamente no está ganando mucho por falta de clientela. 

La señora se dedica a la venta ambulante de zapatos. Vende zapatos de mujer del catalogo “El Cleo”, y sus clientes le hacen pedidos al contado y al crédito. Ya lleva 13 años con este negocio, el cual inició con un préstamo de la fundación ESPOIR. Se acuerda todavía que su primer préstamo fue de 130 sucres (en esa época, Ecuador usaba otra moneda, no estaba dolarizado todavía). Ella vende sus productos a las trabajadoras de la municipalidad, del hospital, y a las profesoras; sale todos los días a cobrar y a vender. Como ya tiene bastante experiencia en este rubro, conoce a las clientas y sabe a quien puede fiar y a quien no. Dice que ser vendedora ambulante es mejor que tener un local fijo, porque ella puede salir a encontrar sus clientes y a cobrarles, no tiene que permanecer sentada en un lugar todo el día. Tiene unos 30 clientas fijas, y vende unas 2 docenas de zapatos cada mes. Antes pedía zapatos americanos también, los cuales le mandaron desde Estados Unidos en una maleta, pero dice que ya no es muy rentable este negocio y prefiere vender del catalogo no mas. 

Invertirá este crédito para comprar más zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientas. 

Ella dice que le gusta trabajar porque le gusta tener sus ingresos independientes, así se viste ella y viste a su hijo también. Su sueño para el futuro es poner una cevichería en Guayaquil. Si su hijo iba para allá para estudiar dice que tendría que irse a cada rato para visitarle y dejarle la ropa lavada, entonces podría ser buena idea poner un negocio allá también.
texts.en:
Sra. Ercilia is a member of the Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Communal Bank, a large group of women that meets every two weeks at the ESPOIR office in Jipijapa, a small town on the Ecuadorian coast. She is a lovely and friendly woman who enjoys talking with people. Sra. Ercilia is in a common law marriage and the mother of 2 children. Unfortunately, her daughter died at the age of 16. Her son is finishing his high school education at the moment and hopes to continue his studies and become a doctor someday. She is looking at the possibility of sending him to medical school in Guayaquil. Her husband is a technician who spends his time repairing computers, televisions and radios. Lately, he has not had much business due to a lack of customers.

Sra. Ercilia sells shoes door-to-door. She sells women’s shoes from a catalog called “El Cleo”, and her customers place their orders and pay with cash or on credit. She started her business 13 years ago with the help of a loan from Fundación Espoir. Sra. Ercilia still remembers that her first loan was in the amount of 130 sucres (Ecuador was still using another currency at the time and had not started using the US dollar). Her customers are municipal workers, hospital employees, and teachers. She leaves home every day to take orders and collect payments. Already she has gained considerable business experience, knowing which clients to grant credit and which ones to refuse. As a saleswoman, she says it is better to sell door-to-door rather than from a fixed location because she can go find her clients and collect from them rather than sit in one place all day. She has around 30 regular clients and sells about 2 dozen pairs of shoes each month. Her customers would also request American brand shoes, which she would have shipped to her in a suitcase. However, that did not prove to be profitable, so she prefers to sell through the catalog.

Sra. Ercilia will use her loan to buy more shoes to offer to her clients. She enjoys working because she likes having her own income, which she uses to buy clothes for herself and her son also. Her dream for the future is to open a cevichería in Guayaquil. If her son ends up going to medical school there, then she could visit him all the time and do his laundry. Therefore, it would be a good idea to open a business there as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Teresa Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas, un grupo grande de mujeres que se reúne cada dos semanas en la oficina de Espoir en Jipijapa, una pequeña ciudad en la costa ecuatoriana. Ella tiene 60 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos y 7 nietos. 3 de sus hijos ya son independientes, mientras uno vive todavía con ella y también le ayuda con su negocio. Su esposo es maestro de construcción. 

Teresa vende comida desde su casa, ubicada unas 4 cuadras del centro, donde ya hace 3 años tiene un pequeño restaurante de nombre “Teresita.” Vende almuerzos y meriendas, y prepara platos variados según su estado de ánimo y los ingredientes que tiene a mano. Los almuerzos generalmente consisten de una sopa y un plato fuerte, mientras las meriendas son arroz con menestras y carne asada (de pollo o res). Ella comienza a cocinar en la mañana, y ya sus clientes comienzan a llegar para almorzar a las 11am. Ella termina de vender las meriendas a las 9 o 9:30 de la noche. Cada día vende unos 20 almuerzos y 30 meriendas. Ella misma prepara la comida, pero sí cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo y una señora.

Teresa está pidiendo este préstamo para poder comprar gaseosas, ingredientes, una vajilla nueva para reemplazar la que está usando actualmente (la cual está algo dañada), y también algunos adornos para mejorar el ambiente de su local. 

Dice que tiene ilusiones grandes para el futuro, por ejemplo le gustaría mucho viajar a España para visitar a los parientes que tiene que están viviendo allá.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the United Women cooperative bank, a large group of women that meet every two weeks in the offices of ESPOIR, in Jipijapa, a small town on the Ecuadorian coast. She is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children and 7 grandchildren. 3 of her children now live on their own, while one still lives with her and helps her with her business. Her husband works in construction. Teresa sells food from her home, located 4 blocks from the center of town. For 3 years, she has had a small restaurant called “Teresita”. She sells lunch and snacks, and prepares a variety of dishes based on her customers’ likes and the ingredients she has on hand. Lunches generally consist of a soup and a main course, while afternoon snacks might be rice stews and roasted meat (chicken or beef). She starts cooking in the morning, and customers begin to arrive for lunch at 11 am. She finishes selling food at 9 or 9:30 at night. Each day, she sells 20 lunches and 30 afternoon snacks. She makes the food herself, but does have help from her son and another lady. Teresa is requesting this loan so she can buy sodas, ingredients, and ceramic ware to replace the one she is currently using (which is somewhat damaged), and also some decorations to improve the ambiance of her establishment. She tells us she has great ambitions for the future, for example, traveling to Spain to visit some of her relatives that are living there.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas, ingredients, ceramic ware, and decorations for her restaurant.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a husband and father of five children who are currently in school. He is 45 years old and trades in charcoal. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. James obtains his supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Techiman and sells it to his customers. 

He wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal to increase his stock. He believes the loan will enable him to increase his savings and provide for the educational needs of his children. He dreams to make enough to complete his building project and would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es: Gladys Esperanza García P. tiene 47 años. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de prendas. Ella dio inicio a su actividad económica porque no tenía un salario para proporcionar a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y además le gusta mucho porque sus clientes siempre le solicitan nuevos productos para su actividad económica. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de oro, plata, oro laminado, líquidos para limpiar las prendas. Sus sueños son de seguir manteniendo su negocio para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Gladys Esperanza García P. is 47 years old. It has been more than 3 years since she dedicated herself to this business. Her economic activity is the sale of clothing. She began this activity because she didn’t have a salary to provide her family with the necessary income. She is a very happy woman, and also enjoys her business because her customers always request new products from her. The reason for requesting this financing is for working capital, to buy gold, silver, plated gold, clothing detergent. Her dream is to continue supporting her business so she can augment her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 32 years old. She is married with four children. Currently, all her children are in school. Yaa is a trader who sells used clothes. Used clothes are bought by many people for their daily wear, so Yaa has many customers. Most people buy used clothes because of the high price of new clothes.

However, with her small amount of capital, Yaa can barely buy more clothes to sell to make a profit. She wants this loan, therefore, to buy more bales of used clothes, with good variety to meet the desires of her customers, and to increase the income of her family. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buys bales of used clothing

loans.name: Mariam Carmita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Campesinas de Ruizho esta ubicado en el sector de Ruizho, perteneciente a la comunidad de San Bartola  de Sigsig, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Cuenca, su terreno es en su mayor parte accidentado.
Las principales producciones de la región son: maíz, fréjol, cebada, trigo, habas, arveja, patatas. En la parte baja se produce caña de azúcar y variedad de árboles frutales.
La parroquia se encuentra atravesada de norte a sur con yacimientos mineros de plata y hierro, existiendo también en la región sur criaderos de cal.
La principal industria es la agricultura, si bien muchos se dedican a la manufactura del tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este banco Comunal esta conformado por personas muy colaboradoras, organizadas y puntuales, el desarrollo de sus labores en el campo es la base fundamental para el compañerismo ya que cuando alguien necesita ayuda realizan mingas comunales, así también cuando hay festejos asisten todos.

Mariam tiene 24 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 7,5 y 3 años, los dos primeros estudian en la escuela de Ruizho, vive en la casa de los papas, es soltera, es socia del Banquito ya mucho tiempo, este es el cuarto crédito que realiza, se dedica desde muy pequeña a la crianza de pollos, este es un negocio familiar ya que toda su familia trabaja en ello, el crédito que hoy solicita es para invertir en pollos y alimentación, cuenta que esta por adquirir tres cajas de pollos, estos vienen 100 por cada caja, son de un día de nacidos y cuesta 84 dólares por caja, el tiempo de crianza y engorde es de 8 semanas, salen de 6 libras aproximadamente, tiene un puesto den las ferias del CREA y Paraíso, vende pollo enteros y por libras, vende a 1.25 dólares la libra y si se trata de otro tipo de pollo(cubano amarillo) cuesta 1.50 dólares la libra, la meta que tiene en su vida es poder hacerse su propia casa para independizarse y poder hacer su propio negocio, ya que en este que hoy tiene le toca aporta por igual a todos.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank “Campesinas de Ruizho” is located in the Ruizho sector, which belongs to the San Bartola of Sigsig community. This area is located an hour from the city of Cuenca, and the land is environmentally sensitive. The primary crops of the region are: corn, beans, barley, wheat, peas, and potatoes. In the lower sections, sugar cane and fruit trees are grown. The town is surrounded by silver and iron mines to the north and south, and in the south there are also lime pits. Agriculture is the primary industry, and many also dedicate themselves to producing hand-made straw hats. This cooperative bank is comprised of people that are very collaborative, organized, and punctual. Carrying out farming tasks is the fundamental base for their companionship, and when anyone needs assistance they all come together as a group to help. They also work together during festivals. Mariam is 24 years old, and has 3 children ages 7, 5 and 3. The two oldest study at the school in Ruizho. She lives in her parents’ home, is single, and has been a member of the bank for a long time. This is her fourth loan, and she has dedicated herself since a young girl to raising chickens. This is a familiar arena for her, given that her whole family is in the same business. The loan she is requesting today is to invest in chickens and feed. She tells us that she wants to acquire three boxes of chickens, which each have 100 chickens in them. They are one day old and cost $84 USD per box. The time to raise and fatten them is 8 weeks, until they reach about 6 pounds approximately. She has a stall at the markets of CREA and Paradise, where she sells her chickens whole and by the pound. She sells them for $1.25 USD per pound, and if it’s a different type of chicken (yellow Cuban) they cost $1.50 USD per pound. Her life’s goal is to have her own home and live independently, and to continue managing her own business given that, these days, everyone must contribute equally.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a 51-year-old woman. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch or supper. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. She dreams of making more profit with the assistance of the loan .

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for banku

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Elvia es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas, un grupo grande de mujeres que se reúne cada dos semanas en la oficina de Espoir en Jipijapa, una pequeña ciudad en la costa ecuatoriana. Ella tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor de edad y tres son menores todavía. Ella trabaja como vendedora en la farmacia de su hermana, un trabajo que viene realizando desde hace 5 años. Antes, trabajaba cosiendo con una señora.
