loans.name: 05-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
"Liên Lê Thị (48) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Liên is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05-Đông Sơn (10.13.05).

Liên is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Liên owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Liên has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. T. Thị Thu (44) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector, running a general store.

2. Đỗ Thị Tân (131) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, making and selling food.

3. N. Thị Vân (152) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, making and selling food.

4. Trịnh Thị Thu (213) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector, operating a tailoring business.

5. Lê Thị Nương (42) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, making and selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Liên Lê Thị (48) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05-Đông Sơn (10.13.05).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2005, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. T. Thị Thu (44) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2. Đỗ Thị Tân (131) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3. N. Thị Vân (152) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. Trịnh Thị Thu (213) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

5. Lê Thị Nương (42) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding their businesses

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a member of Mwande borrowers group. She is a 30-year-old woman,she  is married, and a  mother of two children.Her children aged 9 and 11 years. She also cares for other 1  dependent.

 Halima started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tsh.

This is Halima’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested the amount of 300,000 in order to buy more charcoal. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Halima hopes to expand her business and save more money.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for sale

loans.name: Benkadi 4 De (Benkadi  A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 4 de l’association BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48   ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien  financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 25 hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés hebdomadaires de  Marka-Coungo et Fana, surtout au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of BENKADI 4 group of BENKADI A association are married women who average 48 years of age and 4 children. They live mostly in polygamous families at TINGOLE, main rural town of FANA sub-prefecture, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.They work with microfinance insititution, Soro Yiriwaso in order to have financial support to execute their rainy season businesses. Their businesses are centered on the cultivation of Sorghum and peanuts.They are on their fifth loan with the institution and all past loans had been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicides, small equipment and to pay the cost of weeding and plowing so as to maintain 25 hectares. After harvesting, a portion of their produce is eaten by themselves and the rest is sold in the weekly markets of Marka-Coungo and Fana, mostly for cash to customers made up of men and women.They intend to make an average profit of 30 000FCFA after the farming season.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, fertilizers, herbicites, weeding and small materials

loans.name: 035-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Đạo N. Thị (44) is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Đạo is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 035-Quảng Hưng (18.01.035).

Đạo is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Đạo operates a family member's business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling pork products in the local community. Đạo has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.100.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Đạo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Đạo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đạo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

4. Lê Thị Lý (45) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

5. N. Thị Hân (47) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, running a food stall.

loans.name: Potiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
     Потинисо - женщина, которая занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей 53 года, замужем имеет 4-х детей. Муж на заработках в Алма-ате. Потинисо вместе с сыном  имеет хороший доход с этого бизнеса. Прибыль Потинисо тратит на расходы семьи, а деньги, которые присылает её муж она использует на строительство своего дома. Потинисо на запрашиваемый займ хочет закупить несколько молоденьких барашков и корм для них.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Potiniso is a woman who feeds and sells cattle. She is 53 years old, she is married and has four children. Her husband works now in Alma-ata. Potiniso and her son together get good profit from this business. Potiniso spends the profit on the family's expenses and uses the money which her husband sends to repair her house. Potiniso wants to use the requested loan to buy several more young sheep and the fodder for them.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Benkadi 5  De(Benkadi  A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres  que compose le  groupe  BENKADI 5 de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 28 hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés du  village de Marka-Coungo et Fana,  à une clientèle  venant généralement des grandes villes.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members who compose the group BENKADI 5 of the association BENKADI A are married women who average 45 years of age and 4 children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the seat of a rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support for carrying out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group is now on its fifth experience with the institution. All the preceding loans were repaid without any problems at all. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 28 hectares. After harvesting, a portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold to generally big city customers at the marketplaces of the village of Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a member of the Ushirikiano borrowers group. She is 33, married, and a mother of two. Her children are ages 12 and 2.

Zawadi started her own cafe business selling food 5 years ago; she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzanian shillings (about $67 US).

This is Zawadi's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting 150,000 shillings in order to buy more commodities like rice and sugar for her business. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Zawadi hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for her cafe

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Janet is single. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Janet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
    Санобар женщина 49 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Санобар откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Санобар продает их на скотном рынке. Санобар кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила предыдущий займ, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Санобар планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Санобар очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Sanobar is a 49 year old woman. She is married and has three children. She feeds and sells cattle together with her husband. Sanobar feeds the cattle at home and when it is ready her husband sells it on the livestock market. Sanobar has been our client for one year. She has successfully completed her previous loan and now wants to take out another one. Sanobar plans to increase the number of her cattle and by that increase the profit for her family. Sanobar very much likes our loan terms and she is happy that organization such as this one exist and support society.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Benkadi 6 De (Benkadi  A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 6 de l’association BENKADI A ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et  vivent tous  dans des familles élargies traditionnelles à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous-préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 26 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue exclusivement sur les marchés du  village de Marka-Coungo et Fana, après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée généralement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
NB : Penda Konaté est absente de la photo pour des raisons de santé (chute en moto).
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI 6 of the association BENKADI A average 45 years of age and 6 children. They all live in traditional extended families in TINGOLE, the seat of a rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support for carrying out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group is now on its fifth experience with the institution. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 26 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after the harvests to customers generally composed of big city retailers exclusively at the marketplaces of Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign. Note: Penda Konaté is absent from the photo due to health reasons (motorbike accident).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a member of Kichangani borrower group in Kola ,Morogoro.she is 35 old woman,she is  married, and a mother of four.  Her children are aged 17, 15, 9, and 6 years. 

Mwanaharusi started her own cafe business selling bites 4 years ago, she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings (about $114 US).

This is Mwanaharusi's first loan from BRAC Tanzania.  She requests the amount of 300,000 shillings in order to buy more commodities like rice, wheat, and sugar for her business.  With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Mwanaharusi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  wheat,sugar,cooking oil

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
     Абдусамад - 47 лет. Он женат и отец 4-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Абдусамад занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Абдусамада – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Абдусамад экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Абдусамад продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Abdusamad is 47 years old. He is married and is a father of 4 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home, does domestic work and feeds livestock. Abdusamad is involved in raising and selling livestock. Beginning of summer for Abdusamad is the season for purchasing livestock because livestock is cheap during the summer. And he does not have to spend much for animal feed either. Livestock eats mountain grass, and Abdusamad saves on the feed. With the onset of autumn, Abdusamad sells some of the grown livestock, but does not buy any new livestock. He buys feed to raise the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Benkadi 7 De (Benkadi  A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 7 de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt servira à   acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 24 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue à  Marka-Coungo et Fana,  après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 7 of the association BENKADI A are all married women who average 44 years of age and 3 children. The women live for the most part in traditional extended families in TINGOLE, the seat of a rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support for carrying out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group is now on its fifth experience with the institution. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 24 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after harvesting to customers composed of men and women in Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Мухаббат Гафурова – женщина 47 лет. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Она занимается продажей детских игрушек на Центральном рынке Джаббор-Расуловкого района. Мухаббат закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Её муж Гафуров Абдусаттор мастер строительных работ. Он тоже зарабатывает неплохо, но по мере требования взрослых детей, ему не удаётся накапливать деньги. Мухаббат уже 3 года занимается этим бизнесом. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас она расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию мягких игрушек . Теперь у Мухаббат увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Muhabbat G. is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 5 children. She sells children's toys at the Central market of the Jabbor-Rasulov district. Muhabbat buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there twice per month. Her husband, Abdusattor Gafurov, is a master builder. He also earns well, but due to the needs of the older children, he is unable to save money. Muhabbat has been involved in this business for 3 years. When she first started, she had a small quantity of merchandise, but expanded her selection since then. She used her last loan to purchase a stock of plush toys. Now Muhabbat's merchandise selection increased.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys

loans.name: Bimunira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
      Бимунире - 30 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Бимунира занимается переработкой козьей шерсти и производства шерстяной нити. Она этим занимается вместе со своей свекровью. Они домохозяйки, нигде не работают и дома занимается этой деятельностью. Их мужья занимаются скотоводством. Они перепродают скот, откармливают крупно-рогатый скот.  Бимунира и её свекровь помогают мужчинам в увеличении их семейного бюджета. Бимунира кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Она успешно закончила свой предыдущий займ и хочет взять новый.
texts.en:
Bimunira is 30 years old. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. Bimunira is involved in processing goat wool and making wool yarn. She is involved in this together with her mother-in-law. They are both homemakers, not employed and do this business at home. Their husbands are involved in animal husbandry. They resell livestock and raise cattle. Bimunira and her mother-in-law help the men with increasing their family budgets. Bimunira has been a client of our organization for over 2 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and wants to obtain a new one.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel S. is a 39-year-old farmer and father of two children. He started his business in 1999 using a 1-hectare farm that he received from his parents when he married his wife Juanita Salvadoza. He says that he wants to buy an additional 1/2 hectare farm. He also aspires to have a successful life and a sustainable business.

He is asking for a loan worth Php 15,000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemical. The loan will definitely help the whole family achieve a better harvest and income.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Benkadi 8  De (Benkadi A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe BENKADI 8 de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture  de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 14 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue à Marka-Coungo et Fana,  après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group BENKADI 8 of the association BENKADI A are all married women who average 35 years of age and 3 children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the seat of a rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support for carrying out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group is now on its fifth experience with the institution. All the past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, the group members intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment. And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 14 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after the harvests to customers composed of men and women in Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: -Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rizia

texts.en:
Rizia is a member of the Ushirikiano borrowers group.  She is 46 years old and a mother of two.  Her children are aged 13 and 10.  She also cares for other two dependents.

Rizia started her own cafe business selling food 10 years ago.  She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings (about $225 US).

This is Rizia's first loan from BRAC Tanzania.  She requests the amount of 200,000 shillings in order to buy more rice and wheat for her business. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rizia hope to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and wheat for her cafe

loans.name: Dabawara 1 De (Dabawara Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DABAWARA 1 de l’association DABAWARA  sont toutes des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture  de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république  du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le sorgho. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de  l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 23  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue  Marka-Coungo et Fana  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group DABAWARA 1 of the association DABAWARA are all married women who average 46 years of age and 4 children. The women live in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a leading rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their winter-time activities. The crops are peanuts and sorghum. The group is now on its fifth collaboration, and the past loans have indeed been settled. With this new loan, the group members intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 23 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after the harvests to customers composed of men and women in Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and dry gin and has been in this business for the past 20 years.  Maria is 45 years old, a widow with 4 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and dry gin to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and dry gin to sell

loans.name: Dabawara 2 De (Dabawara Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe DABAWARA 2 de l’association DABAWARA  est constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ayant en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture  de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener  à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le sorgho. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution  et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 26  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue à Marka-Coungo et Fana  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The group Dabawara 2 of the Dabawara association is composed of married women with an average age of 40 years old and four children.They live in polygamous families in Tingole, which is the administrative center of a rural town located in the prefecture of Fana, which is the second administrative region of the Mali republic. These women work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to help improve their winter business, which consists of the cultivation of sorgho and peanuts. This is their fifth loan through the institution, and all previous loans were repaid in full. With this new loan they hope to buy fertilizer, pesticides, basic tools and to pay the hoeing and labor fees necessary to maintain 26 hectares. Part of their harvest is saved for their own consumption and the rest is sold at the Marka-Coungo and Fana Markets to both male and female customers. They expect to make an average profit of 25 000 FCFA after the sale of their crop.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor and hoeing fees, fertilizer, pesticides, and basic tools

loans.name: Dabawara 3  De (Dabawara Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes que compose le  groupe DABAWARA 3 de l’association DABAWARA  sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de  FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le sorgho. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels  agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 16 hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés de Marka-Coungo et Fana  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, généralement des revendeurs et de quelques consommateurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the DABAWARA 3 group of the DABAWARA association are all married, and on average are 40 years old with 4 children. They live in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the commune administrative center of the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution to carry out their winter occupation. They speculate peanuts and sorghum. This is their fifth collaboration with this institution and all of their previous loans have been well resolved. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide and small farm equipment, and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 16 hectares. After the harvest, they will consume a part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Marka-Coungo and Fana markets to a clientele composed of men and women, who are generally retailers with a few consumers. They count on making an average profit of 25 000 CFA francs after the campaign.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing et small farm equipment.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda B. of Hacienda Busay, Sta. Mesa, Manapla, Negros Occidental is 48 years old, married with 4 children.

She owns a "Sari-sari" Store - the Philippine equivalent of a community general store that sells just about anything that her neighbors might need - from the usual groceries, some school supplies, charcoal and firewood, to all sorts of drinks. 

To earn additional income Rhoda sells charcoal and firewood in bulk to other stores around the town and in the adjacent areas. Charcoal and firewood are still the main cooking fuels used by most people in the rural areas because they are easy to transport and store, and relatively cheaper than kerosene or liquid petroleum gas which are the usual alternatives. 

For her 15th loan cycle, Rhoda is borrowing PHP 40,000.00 to add to her capital in the general store as well as her charcoal business.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 and for the past five years used the loans she borrowed to support the immediate needs of her family, and to gradually expand her business in the hope that it will not only provide for her financial needs, but also give her fulfillment as an independent entrepreneur.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL INVENTORY & WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade is happily married with 3 children and she is 41 years old. She sells drinks, juice, and pepper soup, and she has been in this business for the past 5 years. Folashade keeps her shop open from 6am to 12am from Monday to Sunday and she is very happy and proud to have LAPO and Kiva as her financial source. She lives in Lagos State.

Folashade is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks, juice, and pepper soup ingredients to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Шохида – молодая женщина 25 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Shohida is a young, 25-year-old woman, who is married and is a mother of 2 children. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. And she raises cattle at home. She helps her husband develop his business because she wants to increase their income in order to expand their family. It is customary to have more than 3 children in rural areas. They want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make a bigger profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
LUCITA D. is a 64 year-old widow with 5 adult children, who lives in Punta Cabahug, Brgy. Zone 6, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Lucita does not want to be a burden to her children so even at 64 she is using her innate cooking skills to earn a living for herself and even help in the family's financial support.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 and has used the loans to fund her small neighborhood eatery - better known in the Hiligaynon dialect as a "carinderia" which offers cooked food to her neighbors who either eat the food on the counter of her food stall or as a take-out. The food business nets about PHP 6,000.00 for Lucita.

This new loan of PHP 10,500.00, her 17th from NWTF-Project Dungganon, will allow Lucita to offer her customers more variety and allow her to cook larger quantities to sell to more people, ultimately increasing her income potential.

Lucita is determined to stay financially independent as long as she is capable of earning her own living, and to also set aside some of her income for her support in the future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL TO BUY INGREDIENTS FOR HER PRODUCTS

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
    Абдурашиту 35 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Абдурашит занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Абдурашита – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Абдурашит экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Абдурашит продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Abdurashit is 35 years old. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home, does domestic work and feeds livestock. Abdurashit is involved in raising and selling livestock. Beginning of summer for Abdurashit is the season to purchase livestock because livestock and feed are cheap during the summer. And he does not have to spend much on the feed either because livestock eats mountain grass; thus, Abdurashit saves on animal feed. With the onset of winter, Abdurashit sells some of the grown livestock, but does not buy any new livestock. Instead he buys livestock feed for the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Barotboi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
     Баротбою 56 лет. У него есть жена и 5-ро детей. Три сына и две дочери. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Дочки помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Баротбой пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он давно уже кредитуется в нашей организации, и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en:
Barotboi is 56 years old. He has a wife and 5 children: three sons and two daughters. His older sons left to work in Russia. By working there, they can send money to their parents. The parents save this money in order to use it for their sons' weddings. The daughters help with the household. Barotboi's wife is involved in processing yarn. She goes to a market by herself in order to sell it. Barotboi grazes livestock in the mountains and comes home very late. He has been working with our organization for a long time and is a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Benkadi  De Fofanabougou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à FOFANABOUGOU  un des villages de la commune rurale de FANA, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ils viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ils comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 5 hectares. Ils s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur le marché hebdomadaire de la ville de FANA.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana, Tingolé, après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BENKADI are married men who average 36 years of age and 3 children. The men live in polygamous families in FOFANABOUGOU, a village in the rural community of FANA, sub-prefecture of FANA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members just started collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being able to carry out their winter-time work. They grow corn exclusively which remains the dominant crop of the area. As for the use of this loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizer and the like, and minor farm supplies and equipment. They also intend to cover the cost of labor for maintaining 5 hectares. Supplies are gotten essentially from the weekly market of the city of FANA. After the harvests, the produce is sold in Fana, Tingolé, to customers composed of men and women. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
  Наврузову Бахтиеру 41 лет. Имеет семью, четырёх детей. Его жена Эркабоева Замира хозяйничает и помогает мужу по бизнесу. Бахтиёр занимается торговлей на местном базаре в Джабборрасуловском районе. Продаёт продукты питания, закупает товар раз в неделю у поставщиков и фирм в городе по оптовой цене. Бахтиёр   тоже считается оптовиком в своём районе и старается расширить свой товарооборот. Он сотрудничает с Микроинвест несколько лет и получил уже кредит несколько раз, ему понравилось наша услуга и он до сих пор пользуется им. Бахтиёр благодарен Микроинвесту за финансовую поддержку
texts.en:
Bahtiyor N. is 41 years old. He has a family and four children. His wife, Zamira Aerkaboeva, takes care of the household and helps her husband with the business. Bahtiyor is involved in sales at a local market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district. He sells food products and buys his products in the city once per week from suppliers and firms at wholesale prices. Bahtiyor is also considered a wholesaler in his district and tries to increase his product turnover. He has been cooperating with MicroInvest for several years and obtained credit several times already. He liked our service, and he still uses it. Bahtiyor is grateful to MicroInvest for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of food products

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo has been a single parent for the past 10 years and life is a little difficult for her because she has to cater for herself and 5 of her children who are still in secondary school. Titilayo sells cement out of her home and she has been in the business for the past 2 years, after learning the business in 6 months. Titilayo is 40 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cement to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to sell

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks, and she been in the business for the past 16 years. Bolale lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Bolale is very grateful to LAPO and Kiva for their financial support in these hard times. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De  (Benkadi  Fofodiana) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de FOFODIANA,  commune de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 27  hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, de Marka-Coungo et de Fana à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 1 are married women who average 44 years of age and 4 children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in the village of FOFODIANA, in the community of Tingolé, FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum, peanuts, and beans. They are on their fifth experience with the institution. The past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 27 hectares. After the harvests, a portion of their production is for their own consumption. The other portion is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tingolé, Marka-Coungo, and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Aina

texts.en: Aina sells provisions and drinks in her house and she has been in this business for the past 7 years. Aina is focused on her business; she does not welcome any distractions when it comes to her business. She is 38 years old and married. Aina lives in Lagos State. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells shoes and bags. She goes to the Republic of Benin to buy her goods. Bola has been in her business for the past 5 years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past year. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags and shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: La Solución 5 Group

texts.en:
Wanda R. M. (far right), a mother of two children ages 4 and 1, is taking out her very first loan with Esperanza. While she has been selling clothing for many years, she sees this loan as an opportunity to see her business take off.

Living in a rented home with her husband and children, Wanda sells her clothing to her neighbors directly. She travels to the Dominican Republic capital of Santo Domingo to purchase the shoes, shirts, blouses and skirts she sells in her area. A new highway finished recently has given Wanda the ability to travel to Santo Domingo in just two and a half hours, whereas before, the trip took over five hours. This has made selling clothing more profitable and less time-consuming than previously. With her new loan, Wanda plans to increase the quality and variety of shoes she sells, which were previously financially out of reach.

Wanda dreams of using the profits from her business to pay her way through college. A new university campus is opening in Samaná, and Wanda is going to start taking classes in marketing next month. She is hoping that the profits garnered from this loan and her business will help pay for this education. She hopes to someday, after her career has taken off, to buy a home of her own and move out of her current rental situation.

Thank you for this Kiva loan! Wanda and the other four members of her solidarity group all are hoping to create a better living situation for themselves and their families, and your loan will go a long way toward helping them achieve these goals!

loans.use: additional clothing and shoes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells planks in a sawmill very close to her house. She has been in her business for the past 12 years. Margaret lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She 50 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina sells various types of cereal grains and tea leaves at her business in the Oile Market of Kisumu. She was born in the southern part of Nyanza Province in a town called Kendu Bay. Amina has been selling for about ten years, and has her favorite suppliers of tea from Mombasa. She says that since other people are selling the same items as her, she has to work hard to gain loyal customers. With her loan proceeds, she plans on increasing her stock of tea and cereals so that she is able to provide a good selection to each of her customers.

At 42, Amina struggles at times to pay her four children’s school expenses. She is a widow, and she is the only source of income the family has. Her dream is to buy a house of her own instead of renting like she currently does. She says that her children are smart, but are currently being held back by a lack of financial resources. She would like to remedy that situation by earning more through her business.

Amina has already overcome a lot of adversity. At the end of 2007 and beginning of 2008, her business was looted and destroyed in the aftermath of the Kenyan election. She says that to this day, her business has been slow to recover. Her hope is that this loan will provide the necessary boost to get her and her family back on their feet.

loans.use: A new supply of tea leaves and cereals for resale

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael lives in Lagos and she sells plastics, drinks, and kitchen items out of her house. She is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in her business for 10 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more plastics, drinks, and kitchen items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics, drinks, and kitchen items  to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 4 De (Benkadi Fofodiana) Group

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells used shoes in the Oile Market of Kisumu.  She has lived in this city her whole life, and has been running her business for over seven years.  Rose says that her dream is to send her children to school so that they can “finish poverty in the home once and for all.”  She would like to build a house and get some land.  Some of the challenges that she faces are not having enough money to put back into the business and a low supply of shoes ever since the political unrest and resulting violence in 2007 and 2008.  Her stock was stolen or destroyed, and she has had trouble rebuilding ever since.  Her husband is currently out of work, and she provides the sole income for the family.  When asked what is the most important thing she can teach her children, Rose responded by saying, “They need to learn how to run a successful business.”

loans.use: A new stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: La Solución 6 Group

texts.en:
Lucila A. M. (far right) is a hardworking mother of three seeking to augment her clothing sales business with her first loan through Esperanza. Selling shoes and used clothing, Lucila goes door to door to find out what those in her neighborhood need and travels to the Dominican capital of Santo Domingo to fulfill the orders.

Lucila has sold clothing for as long as she can remember, and has thus far been able to support her three children, ages 14, 13 and 8. With this loan, she hopes to further expand her business and use the profits for the benefit of her family. Currently, Lucila is expanding her home, but the addition lacks a roof and floor. She is hoping that as her business grows, she can finish the additional rooms of her home to accommodate the five people currently living under her roof.

A local university is opening in her city of Samaná, and Lucila is also planning on using her earnings to attend clases there to study real estate sales. She would love to someday help people sell their farms and other agricultural land.

Thank you for your loan to this Kiva entrepreneur! Lucila and the other four women in her solidarity group are all dedicated to wisely steward their new loan and use the profits from their businesses to provide a better living situation for their families.

loans.use: new clothing and shoes to increase sales inventory

loans.name: Benkadi 5 De (Benkadi  Fofodiana) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 5  sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de FOFODIANA, commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  elles comptent  acheter de l’engrais,  de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 25 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, de Marka-Coungo et de Fana  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI 5 group are married women who have an average age of 50 and an average of 7 children. The majority of them live in polygamous families in the village of FOFODIANA, in the commune of Tingolé, in the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to have financial support to carry out their winter occupation. They cultivate sorghum, peanuts and beans. This is their fifth experience with this institution and all past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicides and small farm equipment and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 25 hectares. They will consume one part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Tingolé, Marka-Coungo and Fana markets to a clientele composed of men and women. They count on making an average profit of 50,000 CFA francs after the campain.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing and small farm equipment.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka runs a business selling tea leaves in the Oile Market of Kisumu. She is part of a network of business ladies who sell similar items there. They are on different sides of the market and have different customers, but provide each other with support since they know the challenges of each other’s business. With her loan, Milka wants to buy a bigger supply of tea leaves.

A few years ago, Milka left her abusive husband and set out on her own. She says that things aren’t easy, but that she has big dreams. She wants to build her own house instead of renting from someone else. She doesn’t have any children of her own, but she looks after the two children of her deceased brother. It is tough for her to feed and clothe the children, but she knows that she is the only one they can count on.

loans.use: More tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa sells charcoal and chocoties (a mixture of beans and maize) every day in the Manyatta neighborhood of Kisumu. She used to sell in the Oile Market closer to town, but the post-election violence at the end of 2007 forced her to move her business. She wants to grow her business and provide a good education for her five children. She says that she wants to give her children something that she never had—the chance to learn in school.

For Teresa, life is still very challenging. Her husband is a boda boda driver (bicycle taxi) and makes very little money. She says that after household expenses, there is very little left to put back into the business. She would like to take her loan and buy more charcoal, maize, and beans. With a little boost, her business can help provide the income her family needs.

loans.use: More charcoal, maize, and beans to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene in her house. Florence purchases her kerosene from a depot and she has been in the business for the past 4 years. She is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more kerosene to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hard-working businesswoman. She has had a business selling used handbags for over seven years. She says that things are going okay, but times have been tough after the post-election violence in Kenya at the end of 2007. With a low level of stock, she says that she can’t attract a lot of customers.

With a child starting high school in January, Florence is concerned that she will not be able to afford the increased school fees. She would like to eventually take up small-scale farming in addition to the business she runs in town. With her loan proceeds, Florence will invest in a fresh supply of used handbags so that she can start bringing in the profits that she once did.

loans.use: More used handbags to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells slippers, pot and cloth in her house. She has been in this business for the past 9 years. Esther lives in Abeokuta. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Esther hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more cloth, pots and slippers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers, pots, and cloth

loans.name: Kobada 1 De (Kobada Nokabougou) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOBADA 1  sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 59 ans, 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de NOKABOUGOU,  commune de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont en  partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un appui financier pour exercer leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont entre autres la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 20 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOBADA 1 group are married women who are on average 59 years old and have an average of 6 children. The majority live in polygamous families in the village of NOKABOUGOU, in the commune of Tingolé, in the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of Mali. They are in partnership with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution with the goal of having financial support to practice their winter occupation. Among their activities is the cultivation of sorghum, peanuts, and beans. This their fifth experience with this institution and all of the previous loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide and small farm equipment, and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 20 hectares. They will consume one part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Tingolé, Marka-Coungo and Fana markets to a clientele made up of men and women. They count on making an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs after the campaign.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing et small equipment.

loans.name: Kobada 2 De (Kobada Nokabougou) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOBADA 2  est composé de dix femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de NOKABOUGOU,  commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Les membres de ce groupe sont en  partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un appui financier pour exercer leurs activités hivernales qui sont entre autres la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés correctement.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 23 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The KOBADA 2 group is made up of ten married women who have an average age of 40 and an average of 6 children. The majority live in polygamous families in the village of NOKABOUGOU, in the commune of Tingolé, in the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of Mali. The members of this group are in partnership with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution with the goal of having financial support to practice their winter occupation which is, among other activities, the cultivation of sorghum, peanuts and beans. This is their fifth experience with this institution, and all previous loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and small farm equipment, and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 23 hectares. They will consume one part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana markets to a clientele made up of men and women. They count on making an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs after the campaign.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing et small farm equipment.

loans.name: Dinah Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Dinah Jepkemboi is a 40-year-old mother of three, married to Mr Barmau. She operates a dairy business at Kapsoio farm, on the outskirts of Eldoret, a major agricultural town in Western Kenya. Dinah was introduced to KADET by a member of her current borrowers' group.

Dinah has been in agribusiness for the past nine years now. With the loan from KADET, she intends to pay casual labourers to prepare the planting holes for more passion fruits. In addition, she will procure more animal feed for her dairy cows.

In future she hopes to expand her dairy farming and passion fruits production, hoping this will result in improved revenues and thus enable her pay to educate her children at higher learning institutions.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To pay for farm labour and animal feed

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Señora Edith is 25 years old and lives in a settlement called "Luz y Paz" (Light and Peace) in the city of Pucallpa. Edith has a business selling clothing and basic food staples. She works together with her husband, with whom she has three children. These children give Edith the motivation to keep progressing with her business.

Edith used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase clothing for sale. Edith plans to use this loan of 1000 soles for the same purpose. She and her husband sell their products in the small villages and towns along the banks of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.

Edith is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping working women and for educating them about how to run their businesses successfully. The organization's work helps motivate Edith to continue facing life with optimism.

Edith's goals are to grow her business, sell more products and obtain enough money to eventually purchase a piece of land along the river. On this plot of land Edith hopes to grow crops typical of the region.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Jane Jerotich

texts.en:
Jane K. is 35 years old and a mother of three children. She lives with her family in the Kapsosio area, Nyota Centre Canteen near Eldoret town.Jane was introduced to KADET by a friend with whom they attend church together.

She has been in the poultry-keeping business for the last two years. With the loan she is applying from KADET, she intends to buy construction materials like chicken wire mesh to put up a poultry house.
