Mr. Alejandro José has been a maintenance officer for three years; he started as an assistant. With this loan, his second with Afodenic, he will buy a floor polishing machine and a compressor.

His objective is to have all the equipment to work for himself and get better benefits. His goal is to be able to stop his job and study civil engineering and provide his family with a more comfortable situation. He gives his thanks the the institution for their support with this loan and satisfying his needs. .

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a polisher and a compressor

loans.name: Soulemane

texts.fr: Célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres charges, ce monsieur a commencé en 2006 le commerce de détail de portables. Il veut reconstituer son stock  pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui grandit,pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 portables de hautes gammes.
texts.en:
Unmarried and having to support himself, this gentleman started a retail business for mobile phones in 2006.  He wants to replenish his inventory to satisfy further his growing customer base.  To do so, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 high-end cell phones.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones

loans.name: Heydi Lizeth

texts.es: La joven Heydi Liseth U. Álvarez , tiene la edad de 21 años , habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace tres años ella  trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su suegro . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena producción y poder ofertar al mercado a buen precio.
texts.en:
The young Heydi Liseth U. Álvarez is 21 years old and lives in the neighborhood called Pilas Orientales, located in Masaya, along with her husband which she supports with the expenses of the home. She has two children in her care. The plans with regard to her family is to improve their living conditions. For three years she has worked as a farmer. The greatest difficulty that she is presented with is the lack of financing. She began this activity with the support of her father-in-law. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to obtain a good production and to be able to offer her crops to the market for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El señor Luís Enrique tiene la edad de 52 años, reside en el barrio Rubén Darío en la capital de Managua, soltero y con dos hijos que le tienen mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de cosmético al por mayor tiene quince años de vender, el cual inicio con prestamos para comprar al mayor. Con este crédito espera comprar mercadería variada, para vender al mayor y poder obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es ampliar su negocio. Su meta es poder comprar un tramo para dejar heredado a sus hijos y poder mantener la unidad familiar. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzado ya que gracias a los prestamos ha podido crecer en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señor Luís Enrique is 52 years old. He resides in the neighborhood Rubén Darío in the capital of Managua. He is single with two children that are of legal age. His business is the sale of cosmetics wholesale, which he has been doing for fifteen years. He started with a loan to buy wholesale. With this credit he hopes to buy various merchandise to sell wholesale and to be able to obtain better profits. He plans to expand his business. His goal is to be able to buy a plot of land to leave for his children to inherit and to be able to maintain the household. He gives thanks to the institution for the achievements he has reached, since thanks to the loans he has been able to grow his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina P. tiene 27 años, está casada con el Sr. Luis Cabrera Flores, llevan tres años de casados. Tienen un bebe de 1 año de edad. Viven en una zona que se dedica a la produccion de leche.

La Sra. Marina lleva trabajando con ganado lechero 10 años, entrega todo lo que produce a una microempresa local que elabora productos lácteos para la venta en un mercado de la ciudad de Cbba. Empezó trabajando con su madre y poco a poco fue comprando su propio ganado para independizarse. 

Necesita del préstamo para poder comprar alimento de ganado debido a que debe almacenar para todo el año. Esto repercutirá en su producción ya que no tendrá escases de alimento y producirá mas leche para generar más ingresos. 
En un futuro desea comprar más vacas lecheras e incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejorar su casa y darle a su bebe una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Marina P. is 27 years old. She is married with Señor Luis Cabrera Flores. They have been married for three years and have a baby who is 1-year-old. They live in a zone that is dedicated to the production of milk. Señora Marina has been working raising dairy cattle for 10 years. She delivers everything that she produces to a local micro-business that makes dairy products for sale in a market in the city of Cochabamba. She began working with her mother and little by little began buying her own cattle to become independent. She needs the loan to be able to buy food for her cattle in order to store enough for all the year. This will impact her production since she will not have a scarcity of food and will produce more milk to generate more income. In the future she hopes to buy more dairy cows and to increase her income to be able to improve her house and to give her baby better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for raising dairy cattle

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa de Jesús C., tiene la edad de 37 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene cuatro hijos de 24, 18, 15,13, años, dos de ellos ya son casado y dos están a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo y la afectación del volcán , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo .Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús C., age 37, lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood of La Concepción together with her husband, who assists her with household expenses. They have four children, ages 24, 18, 15, and 13, two of which are already married, and two are still at home. She plans to improve the quality of her family's life. She has been in the agriculture business for the last 21 years. Her major difficulties come from pests that affect plant growth and the behavior of the nearby volcano. Teresa de Jesús began farming through the support of her parents. Her future plans are to diversify her crops. With this loan she will buy fertilizer and supplies to improve her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Alejandro Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Alejandro Adolfo U. T., tiene la edad de 32 años habita en el barrio Veracruz, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años, actualmente estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Alejandro desde hace 7 años trabaja como transportista, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento para poder construir su vivienda, el inicio la construcción con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su esposa , los planes futuro es poder terminar de construir su vivienda .Con el financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar hacer las mejoras. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los prestamos.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro Adolfo U. T. is 32 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Veracruz with his wife who works and helps with the household expenses. They have two children, aged 10 and 12, who attend school.

His plans are to better the conditions of life for his family and in order to do this, Alejandro has been working as a carrier for the last 7 years. The greatest challege for him is that he lacks the money to build his house; he has started construction himself with the help of his wife. His plan for the future is to be able to finish constructing his house.

With the loan he will buy construction materials to being to make improvements. He gives thanks to the institution for their support in giving him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es: Elaboración de masitas, tortas, empanadas y rollitos es el negocio de la mayoría de las integrantes de la Asociación Comunal “El Sol”, también otras se dedican a vender ropa de hombre, mujer y niño. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de insumos como la harina, levadura, leche, mantequilla y compra de mercadería. Están juntas hace 3 años aproximadamente y los créditos que obtuvieron siempre lo han invertido en el negocio, además a todas les gusta capacitarse y hacerse controles en el consultorio de Salud.
texts.en:
The majority of the members of the El Sol cooperative make pastries, meat pies, and small rolls. Other members sell clothing for men, women, and children. They all need the loan to purchase supplies such as flour, yeast, milk and butter, or to buy merchandise.

They have been together for approximately three years. All of their previous loans have been invested in the business. In addition, they would all like to improve their competence and get medical check ups at the health clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: El señor José Feliciano López A., tiene la edad de 28 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos los cuales   le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas en tiempos libres , don José desde hace 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder hacer trabajos de conservación de suelo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Jose Feliciano, 28 years of age, lives in San Ignacio with his wife and three children. His wife works to help with household expenses and the children help with the agricultural work in their free time. Jose has been farming for the last eight years.

Their biggest problem is a lack of funding. Jose began farming with his parents' help. His plans for the future include improving their standard of living and working to conserve the soil. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilizer to apply to cultivation, enabling him to obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to improve production

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.en:
Silvia is 36 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She dedicates herself to a variety of business ventures: she does sewing work, sells juice made from "cocona" (a local fruit), and supports her husband in his business. Silvia's husband is an IT specialist and also sells computers and computer parts to customers who place orders with him. Silvia and her husband have a 12-year-old son.

Silvia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about two years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (“New Friends”). She used her first loan of 300 soles to invest in a small grocery shop and in sewing materials. She plans to invest her current loan of 1,300 soles in fabrics, new and used computer parts, and in ingredients to produce her juices made from local fruits such as "cocona" and "aguaje".

Silvia's goal is to one day purchase industrial sewing machines and also to set up a boutique where she can sell her hand-sewn clothing. She is also interested in having a computer store. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos as she feels that the organization has helped her to become financially independent.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials, new and used computer parts, and ingredients to producte fruit juices

loans.name: Heyling Carolina

texts.es: La joven Heyling Carolina López, tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ella tiene un hijo de cinco años de edad , actualmente estudia su preescolar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 5 años , la joven Heyling trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas , ella inicio esta actividad con apoyo de su padres , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos, para mejorar la producción y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Heyling Carolina López is 24 years old and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood with her spouse, who works and helps her with the household activities. She has a 5 years old son, who is currently in pre-school. She plans to improve her family living conditions.

Heyling has been working as a farmer for 5 years. The biggest challenge she faces is the pests. She started this activity with the support of her parents and she plans to diversify her crops.

With the loan she will buy fertilizers and supplies in order to improve her production and sell it at better prices in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to improve crops

loans.name: Genobeba

texts.en:
Señora Genobeba lives in the city of Pucallpa and dedicates herself to the sale of various products in the small communities along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Genobeba is pictured here with a sack of rice and another sack of staple food products.  Genobeba sells these items, as well as fuel.  She keeps her fuel supply stored in the community where her son works as a teacher.  This community is located on the Ucayali River one day and one night's travel by boat from Genobeba's home.  Genobeba considers herself to be an active woman and enjoys selling her products, especially in places located outside the city, both along the river or along the highway that joins Pucallpa and the capital, Lima.

Genobeba is 52 years old and is married with five children, only one of whom is still dependent on her.  Her husband works as a chainsaw operator for the Saenz Company.

Genobeba has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about two years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in clothing and TVs, all of which were ordered in advance by residents of the town of Tournavista located two hours from Pucallpa.  Genobeba will use this loan of 1,500 soles to invest in two barrels of fuel and in other products which she plans to sell along the river.

Genobeba's goal is to eventually have a business out of her home; perhaps a restaurant.  Genobeba is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos and appreciates the facility with which the organization gives credit.  Other banks make obtaining loans much more difficult.

loans.use: Two barrels of fuel for sale; other staple food products for sale

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Rossio Ruth G. es integrante del  grupo  “Virgen de Guadalupe”,  ella tiene su negocio de  transcripciones en su domicilio hace dos años y necesita el préstamo para la compra de una nueva impresora y tinta, ella tiene el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio implementando más adelante otras máquinas y contratar otros transcriptores.  Al igual que Rocio las demás integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de dulces, comida,  ropa (ropa de bebe, chompas) refresco, artículos escolares, otras se dedican al tejido de mantas y costura de chamarras, todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería (dulces, aceite, chambritas, chompas, refresco, hojas, lápices) y compra de materia prima (hilo y tela).
texts.en:
Rossio Ruth G. is a member of the group “Virgen de Guadalupe”. She’s had a transcribing business at home for two years and she needs a loan to buy a new printer and ink. She wishes to grow her business in the future by buying more machines and hiring more transcribers. Similar to Rossio, the other group members have their own businesses such as selling candy, food, clothes (baby clothes, sweaters), refreshments, and school supplies. Other members work weaving fabrics and making jackets. All members need the loan to buy merchandise (candy, oil, baby clothes, sweaters, refreshments, paper, pencils, etc.) and raw materials (thread and fabric).

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, murchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.es:
Jeanina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Jeanina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Jeanina tiene un multiservicio en su casa, en donde vende artículos de regalos, loceria, cristalería, materiales didácticos para niños, además brinda el servicio de locutorio, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Jeanina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales didácticos.
Los sueños de Jeanina son ampliar su negocio, bautizar a sus hijas y que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Jeanina is a member of the village bank called Buena Suerte (Good Luck). Jeanina is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 daughters.

Jeanina has a multiservice business in her home where she sells gifts, china, glassware, educational materials for children and operates a calling center daily in her home.

Jeanina needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in buying more educational materials. Jeanine's dream is to expand her business, baptize her daughters, and to succeed in general.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying educational materials

loans.name: Mirtha Victoria

texts.es:
Mirtha es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Mirtha es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Mirtha tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Mirtha vende ollas renaware por catalogo.
Mirtha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Mirtha son surtir su negocio y ampliar.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the Buena Suerte ("Good Luck") Village Bank. She is 50 years old and is married with two children. Mirtha has a store in her home, where she sells basic grocery items seven days a week. She also sells Renaware pots by catalog. Mirtha needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy milk, sugar, and rice. Her dreams are to expand her business and to offer a wider variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar and rice

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Ana es soltera, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Ana se dedica a la elaboración de molidos y harinas de cereales, los cuales son adquiridos en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y luego los procesa en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Huanta.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, quinua.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio y que su ultimo hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Buena Suerte ("Good Luck") Village Bank. She is 45 years old, single, and has 6 children. She has a mill where she grinds flour from different grains. She purchases the grains at the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho, then she processes them in a rented oven and ultimately sells the finished product in the city of Huanta. Ana needs a loan of 3500 soles to buy wheat, barley and quinoa. Ana's dreams are to improve her business and for her youngest son to become a working professional.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley and quinoa

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Melchora es casada, tiene 63 años y 3 hijos, Melchora es artesana y realiza tejidos en telar como pasadizos, frazadas, actividad que realiza con ayuda de empleados, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados locales y también lo vende a intermediarios que llevan a la ciudad de Cuzco.
Melchora necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas, tintes.
Los sueños de Melchora son mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Melchora is a member of the Buena Suerte ("Good Luck") Village Bank. She is 63 years old and is married with three children. She is an artisan, and weaves blankets and runners on her loom with the help of her workers. She sells her work in local markets and also to intermediaries, who bring the weavings to the city of Cusco. Melchora needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy wool and dyes. Her dreams are to improve her business and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and dyes

loans.name: Leoraria

texts.es:
Leoraria es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Leoraria es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Leoraria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado al frente del mercado 12 de abril, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija, además Leoraria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales.
Leoraria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Leoraria son tener un negocio en la ciudad de Lima y tener local propio.
texts.en:
Leoraria is a member of the village bank "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck).

Leoraria is single, 37 years old, and has two children. Leoraria has a restaurant in a rented place in the front of the 12th of April market. She runs this restaurant with her daughter. Also Leoraria travels to different markets in the region to buy grains.

Leoraria needs a loan of 1000 soles to put towards buying tables and chairs

Leoraria's dreams are to have a business in the city of Lima and to have her own place.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tables and chairs

loans.name: Dioselina

texts.es:
Dioselina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Dioselina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Dioselina vende productos de limpieza y ferretería, sus ventas son al por mayor y los realiza a las diferentes tiendas y ferreterías de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Andahuaylas. Además Dioselina vende artículos de electricidad en diferente ferias de la región.
Diocelina necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de escobas.
Diocelina sueña con tener distribuidoras en otros departamentos y tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Dioselina is a member of Buena Suerte Communal Bank (Buena Suerte translates to "Good luck"). Dioselina is single, twenty-seven years old, and the mother one. Dioselina sells cleaning products and hardware,in wholesale, to different shops and hardware stores in Ayacucho, Andahuaylas. In addition, Dioselina sells electronics at different fairs in the area. Diocelina needs a loan of S./ 3500, which she will use to buy brooms. Diocelina dreams of having doing wholesale in other areas, and of having a wholesale grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing brooms

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Señora Genoveva appears in this photo showing the dresses that she designs and makes.  Genoveva is 55 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  She works independently as a seamstress.  Genoveva's husband has been working at a plywood manufacturing company for the past 34 years.  The couple has six children, only one of whom, a daughter, is still a minor.  

Genoveva has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past eight years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  Genoveva invested her very first loan of 300 soles in clothing sales.  Later she invested other loans in selling hot dogs and french fries from the front porch of her house in the evenings.  Genoveva plans to use this loan of 1700 soles to purchase fabrics and other materials necessary to design and produce her hand-sewn clothing.  

Genoveva's goals are to make the finishing touches on her house, to construct a storefront where she can run a more stable business such as selling cooked food in the evenings, and also to set up a workshop for her sewing business.  Genoveva is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos as the organization enables her to work independently and with her own supply of capital.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other materials

loans.name: Hilda Clenencia

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca
Hilda es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Hilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, además reparte gas a domicilio también vende celulares, actividades que realiza en el mismo local.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, gas.
Los sueños de Hilda son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to Señor de Huanaca Communal Bank. Hilda lives with her life partner, is 39 years old, and has 2 children. Hilda has a store in her house where she sells general groceries, and fruit. She sells soda there too. She also sells cell phones in the same area. Hilda needs a loan of S./ 2600, which she will use to buy sugar, rice, and soda. Hilda dreams of being able to offer her children a good education, so that they become professionals, and of building the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, rice, and soda.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Carmen viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, luego los procesa en harinas, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad e Pisco a donde viaja semanalmente, y de Pisco trae pallar, tomate, camote entre otros productos que vende en el mercado de abastos.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener una tienda en su casa y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to Señor de Huanca Communal Bank. Carmen lives with her life partner, is 40 years old, and has one child. Carmen travels to different fairs in her area to sell cereals. After she processes them in flour, she markets her products in the city and in Pisco, where she goes weekly, and brings butter bean, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes, among other products she sells at the wholesale markets. Carmen needs a loan of S./3000, which she will use to buy corn and wheat. Carmen dreams of running a store in her house, and of finishing building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and wheat

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Domitila es separada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Domitila viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas verduras y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 
Domitila necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Domitila son construir su casa, tener una tienda en su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Domitila belongs to Señor de Huanca Communal Bank. Domitila has separated from her partner, is 54 years old, and has 6 children. Domitila travels to different fairs in her area, selling fruits and vegetables, and buying cereals that she sells at markets in the city, Ayacucho. Domitila needs a loan of S./2000 to buy cereals. Domitila dreams of building her house, running a store in her house, and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyin cereals.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Huanca
Basilia es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Basilia tiene una panadería en su casa en donD. elaboran panes típicos, su horno es artesanal a leña, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias a donD. viaja junto a su esposo, además Basilia tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes.
Basilia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Basilia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilia belongs to Señor D. Huanca Communal Bank. Basilia is married, 55 years old, and the mother of six. Basilia runs a bakery in her house, where she makes basic breads. She uses a handmaD. wood-fired oven. She sells at the fairs in the area -- she and her husband travel to them together. In addition, Basilia has a small grocery store. Basilia needs a loan of S./1000 to buy flour and sugar. Basilia hopes that her children can complete their studies, and would like to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour and sugar

loans.name: Eda Elena

texts.es:
Eda es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Eda es casada, tiene 43 años y 8 hijos, Eda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, animales menores, productos que comercializa de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso y gallinas.
Eda sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Eda is a partner of the Community Bank of Señor de Huanca. Eda is married, 43 years old, and has 8 children. Eda travels to different festivals in the region where she buys cheeses andsmall animals, products she sells house to house in the city of Ayacucho. She needs a loan of $225 that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and chickens. She dreams of giving a good education to her children and having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheese and chickens

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca
Teofila es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Teofila vende comida de manera ambulatoria en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Teofila son mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Teofila is a partner of the Community Bank of Señor de Huanca. She lives with others, is 29 years old, and has 1 child. She sells food in an ambulatory fashion in the markets of the city of Ayacucho, which she does every day. Teofila needs a loan of $225 which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to improve her business and succeed with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Señora Zoila is pictured here in her sewing workshop in the city of Pucallpa where she lives.  Zoila has been working as a seamstress since she was 15.  She is now 63 years old.  Zoila is widowed and has five adult children.  She is currently caring for her two-year-old granddaughter Jimena.

Zoila has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 2.5 years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  Zoila used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in sewing materials and in the sale of cooked foods.  She will use this loan of 1000 soles for the same purpose: Zoila plans to buy fabrics and other materials for sewing and also basic food products for her other business, preparing and selling cooked food from her home in the evenings.  

Zoila's goal is to leave an excellent sewing workshop to her daughters Doris and Fiorella when she passes on.  Zoila is grateful to Manuela Ramos not only for the financial support but also for the educational sessions given by the organization's loan officers at her communal bank's monthly meetings.  Zoila feels that these sessions help her to learn a little more than what experience alone can teach her.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other materials for sewing and food items for selling cooked food

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.
Magdalena es viuda, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Magdalena sen dedica al alquiler D. salones D. recepciones, además brinda servicios D. decoración, preparación D. comida, elaboración D. tortas para diferentes eventos.
Magdalena necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas para decoración y harina.
Magdalena sueña con comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y comprar un horno para la preparación D. tortas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the village bank called Kusirikuy which means rejoice in Quechua.

Magdalena is a widow, 45 years old, and has three children. Magdalena is in the business of renting rooms for receptions. She also provides services like decorating, preparing food, and preparing cakes for different events.

Magdalena needs a loan of 2100 soles to buy fabric for decoration and flour.

Magdalena dreams of buying a car to transport her products and buying an oven for preparing her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric for decoration and flour

loans.name: Norma Gloria

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche.
Los sueños de Norma son comprar una casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a partner of the Community Bank Kusirikuy, which means "rejoice" in Quechua. She cohabits, is 24 years old, and has 3 children. She has a store in a rented place where she sells groceries, vegetables and desk supplies, all of which she accomplishes with the help of her husband. She needs a loan of $525 which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk. Norma's dreams are to buy a house and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.
Nelida es casada, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Nelida junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de maíz pelado (maíz que se pela con ceniza, se utiliza para la preparación de platos típicos), su producto lo comercializa a los mayoristas.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Nelida son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The name of Nelida’s Community Bank is Kusirikuy, which means be happy in Quechua. Nelida, 31, is married and has four children. Nelida and her husband work together making dried corn (corn that is dried with ashes and used to prepare typical dishes). They sell their product to wholesalers. Nelida needs a loan for 450 PEN to buy wood. Nelida’s dreams are to build her house and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Elsa Leonor

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa Leonor tiene 59 años, es divorciada, y tiene 4 hijos, ya mayores de edad con familias propias. Tiene 9 nietos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, carteras y zapatos de forma ambulante; viaja a Guayaquil unas 4 veces por mes para comprar la ropa, y lo vende a crédito. Ella es muy amiguera, entonces no le faltan clientes. Dice que el negocio le resulta más rentable por ser de forma ambulante; así no tiene que pagar todos los costos fijos mensuales si pagaría si tuviera un local. Pero sí es cansado el trabajo, porque tiene que caminar bastante para vender y cobrar. 

También prepara bocaditos y tortas para fiestas cuándo le hacen pedidas, entrega por cientos. Ella ya lleva unos 25 años con este negocio. 

Ahora la señora pide un crédito para poder viajar a Guayaquil y  comprar más  ropa.

La señora es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, el cual se reúne cada 2 semanas en Jipijapa, Manabí, cerca de la costa ecuatoriana. Es un grupo grande que ya tiene bastante tiempo trabajando con la fundación, las socias se llevan muy bien entre ellas. Sra. Elisa es socia del banco comunal hace unos 6 años; una amiga le trajo y le gustó porque es un crédito fácil, entonces se ha quedado todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Leonor is 59 years old. She is divorced and has four children who are now of adult age. She has nine grandchildren, as well. She is involved in the sale of clothing, purses and shoes, as a peddler merchant. She travels to Guayaquil about fours times a month to purchase the clothing, which she, in turn, sells on credit. She is very friendly, so she has no shortage of customers. She claims that the peddling nature of the business proves itself more profitable because she does not have to deal with the fixed overhead costs associated with a store. However, the work is quite tiresome. She must walk a lot in order to sell and collect all the payments. She also prepares pastries and cakes for parties. When she gets these orders, she delivers them by the hundreds. Elsa Leonor has been in this business for about 25 years. She is now requesting a credit in order to be able to travel to Guayaquil to purchase more clothing. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, which meets every two weeks in Jipijapa, Manabi, close to the Ecuatorian coast. It is a large group that has been working with the foundation for quite some time. All its members get along very well. Ms. Elisa has been a member of this bank for 6 years. A friend originally introduced her to it and she liked it because it offers easy credit. She has remained with it ever since.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To travel to Guayaquil and purchase more clothing for her business

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Clementina es soltera, tiene 32 años, Clementina tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. bolsas plásticas, entre otros productos plásticos, productos que adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Clementina necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. plásticos.
Los sueños D. Clementina son comprar un carro y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the village bank Rikchariy, which means Awake in Quechua.

Clementina is single and 32 years old. She has a stall in the market Mariscal Cáceres where she sells plastic bags and other plastic products that she acquires in the city of Lima.

Clementina needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in buying plastic.

Clementina's dream is to buy a car and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying plastic products

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina  es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Agripina es casada, tiene 27 años, Agripina se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Agripina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Agripina son tener un propio horno y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Agripina belongs to Rikchariy Communal Bank, which means "awake" in Quechua. Agripina is married, and 27 years old. Agripina makes traditional breads, a rented oven. She sells her breads at different fairs in the area. Agripina needs a loan of S./600 to buy flour. Agripina dreams of having her own oven, and of buying a car.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Apolonia es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Apolonia compra y vende artesanía variada como telares, adornos, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de lima y Cuzco.
Apolonia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telares.
Los sueños de Apolonia son cambiar de negocio por otro mas rentable y tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Apolonia is a member of “Banco Comunal Rikchariy” (Rikchariy means “Wake Up" in Quechua). Apolonia is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She buys and sells an assortment of handicrafts such as fabrics and ornaments that she sells in the cities of Lima and Cuzco. Apolonia needs a loan of 600 Soles to buy fabrics. Apolonia’s dreams are switching to a more profitable business and having a fixed store location.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Miriam vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el parque y en la puerta de las discotecas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Miriam vende ropa a pedido en la selva ayacuchana.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos y golosinas.
Los sueños de Miriam son tener una tienda de ropa y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Miriam belongs to Rikchariy Communal Bank. Rikchariy means "awake" in Quechua. Miriam lives with her life partner, is 25 years old, and has two children. Miriam sells candy by traveling sales, in the park and at the doors to shops/clubs. In addition to doing this every day, Miriam also sells cloths by order in the Ayacuchana jungle. Miriam needs a loan of S./2100 to buy popsicles and candy. Miriam dreams of having a clothing store, and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying popsicles and candy

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Pastora es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Pastora se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arveja en sus tierras de Yanama, productos que comercializa en el mercado de abastos, además Pastora trabaja en una empresa como encargada de limpieza.
Pastora necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alfalfa.
Los sueños de Pastora son terminar de construir su casa, ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Pastora belongs to Rikchariy Communal Bank. Rikchariy means "awake" in Quechua. Pastora is married, 34 years old, and has 2 children. Pastora grows corn and peas in the Yanama soil. She markets these products in the wholesale food markets. In addition, Pastora works in a business where she is the head of the cleaners. Pastora needs a loan of S./900 to buy alfalfa. Pastora dreams of building her family a house, improving her land, and running a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing alfalfa

loans.name: Dayse

texts.es:
Dayse es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Dayse es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 2 hijos, Dayse se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates con relleno de manera artesanal, sus ventas los realiza a las tiendas por mayor, además Dayse viaja a la feria de Huamanguilla en donde compra maíz y lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Dayse necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y papa.
Los sueños de Dayse son tener una tienda propia y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
The name of Dayse’s Community Bank is Rikchariy, which means wake up in Quechua. Dayse, 21, is in a common law marriage and has two children. Dayse makes hand made, filled chocolates. She sells to wholesale stores. Dayse also travels to the fair in Huamanguilla to buy corn. She sells it in the Abastos market in the city of Ayacucho. Dayse needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy corn and potatoes. Dayse’s dreams are to have her own store and to become an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and potatoes

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
El Banco El Paraíso se encuentra ubicado en el centro D. Huancavelica.

Adriana tiene 02 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, negocio que fue creciendo gracias a su dedicación.  Ella, con la ayuda D. sus créditos quiere mejorar  su tienda y comprar mas mercadería, lo que le generara mas ganancias y así poder ahorrar más, para la construcción D. su casa.

Valentina tiene 03 hijos. Ella inicio un negocio D. venta D. productos variados con su esposo, gracias a los créditos obtenidos el negocio fue mejorando. Con su próximo préstamo comprara mas mercadería en la capital. Actualmente se encuentra ahorrando, ya que tiene dentro D. sus planes, llegar a construir su casa.

Julia es viuda y tiene 01 hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. carne y los días D. feria,  venD. prendas interiores. Ella quiere comprar animales para la venta D. su carne y con las ganancias generadas por estas, comprar mas prendas D. vestir, D. esta manera seguir haciendo crecer sus negocios y llegar a tener un puesto fijo para sus ventas.
texts.en:
“Paradise” Communal Bank is located in downtown Huancavelica. Adriana has 2 children, she sells basic needs products, a business that has grown thanks to her dedication. With the help of her loans she wants to improve her store and buy more merchandise, which will result in greater earnings and in this way she will be able to save more in order to build her house. Valentina has 3 children. She began a business selling a variety of products with her husband. Thanks to the loans she has received her business has been improving. With her next loan she will buy more merchandise in the capital city. Today she is saving, because she has plans to build a house. Julia is a widow and has 1 child. She sells meat and on holidays she sells under garments. She wants to buy animals to sell for their meat and with the earnings buy more clothing items. In this way she will continue growing her business and be able to have a fixed locale for her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their respective businesses

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Maura es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Maura tiene un puesto en el mercado Sr. D. Arequipa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Maura venD. condimentos molidos que ella misma prepara.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. jabón y cereales.
Los sueños D. Maura son mejorar su negocio, su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y apoyar a su nieto.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II.” Maura is married, 50 years old and has 6 children. Maura has a stand in the Sr. D. Arequipa market where she sells general groceries, a business she runs every day. In addition, Maura sells ground condiments that she herself prepares. Maura needs a loan for 1500 soles to invest in buying soap and grains. Maura dreams of improving her business and that her youngest child finishes school, and that she is able to support her grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap and grains

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dionicia es viuda, y tiene 04 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, lo hace D. manera ambulatoria, caminado por las calles D. su ciudad. Dionicia solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles,  los cuales quiere invertir en su negocio y así seguir ahorrando para poder comprara una carreta donD. ofrecer sus productos, y así ya no caminar tanto. 

Aurelia es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Aurelia aprovecha las visitas que le hace a su esposo en la mina donD. trabaja él, para llevar granos y venderlos. Ella, gracias a sus préstamos a podido incrementar las ventas D. su negocio. Ella, solicita un préstamo D. 1,000 soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra D. granos, con cuyas ventas podrá seguir ahorrando para la construcción D. su casa, lo cual tanto anhela.

Eulalia es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Eulalia se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, las cuales vendía en un triciclo que tuvo que vender porque cayó enferma. Ella ya recuperada sigue trabajando con sus golosinas. Eulalia solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles, con los cuales apoyara a uno D. sus hijos en la venta D. ropa. Ella quiere seguir ahorrando para poder obtener un puesto fijo para sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a widow and has four children. She is involved in the sale of candy and snacks, which she does in a peddling manner, walking the streets of the city. Dionicia is requesting a loan of 300 soles, which she wants to invest in the purchase of a cart from where she could sell her products. This way she would have to walk less. Aurelia is married and has one child. She takes advantage of visits to her husband's mine, where he works, to sell grains. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her business' sales. She is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of grains. With its sales, she will be able to continue saving for the construction of her home, which is her big wish. Eulalia is married and has two children. Eulalia is involved in the sale of candy and snacks. She sells her merchandise off a tricycle that she had to give up, when she became sick. Now recovered, she continues selling candy and snacks. Eulalia is requesting a loan of 300 soles. With it, she will assist one of her children in the sale of clothing. Her wish is to continue saving in order to purchase a permanent stall for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of Bancomunal La Esperanza request a loan to invest in their business

loans.name: Julia Alicia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Julia es casada, tiene 55 años y 11 hijos, Julia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa, se dedica a la compra y venta de tara, cochinilla, también arrienda terrenos de donde cosecha estos productos, además en épocas de producción de tuna compra y vende esta fruta.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus 2 hijos menores concluyan sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II.” Julia is married, 55 years old and has 11 children. Julia lives in the Huayllapampa community. She buys and sells tara, prickly pear cactus, and she rents land where she grows these products. In addition, she seasonally grows and sells prickly pear fruit. Julia needs a loan for 1050 soles to invest in buying tara. Julia dreams that her 2 youngest children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tara

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
Nolberta es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Nolberta es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Nolberta tiene un molino en su casa en donD. brinda el servicio D. molienda, además compra cereales que le traen los productores para luego procesarlos en harinas, producto que venD. en la selva ayacuchana.
Nolberta necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales.
Además Nolberta sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nolberta is a member of the Bienstar II Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a grain mill in her home where she provides milling services. She also buys grain from producers and processes it into flour, which she sells in Ayachucho.

Nolberta needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase grain. She also hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Rufina es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Rufina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende panes, frutas, abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, carne, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Rufina son construir una casa de material noble y vender sus productos en la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the Bienstar II Communal Bank. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. She travels to different regional fairs to sell bread, fruit and groceries. While at the fairs, she purchases grain, cheese, meat and other products which are then sold in the city markets of Ayacucho.

Rufina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy grain. She dreams of constructing a house made of solid materials and selling her products in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Irma es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Irma tiene una tienda en si casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Irma tiene un carro que hace transporte publico.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Irma son construir su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Bienstar II Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. Irma operates a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, and fruit. Her business is open every day, and she also owns a car that she rents out as a public transportation vehicle.

Irma needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of building a house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 70 años, como madre trata de esforzarse para ayudar a sus hijos en sus diversas actividades para no sentirse una carga en la casa, ya que sus hijos viven con sus propias familias. Desde que dejó de tener la fuerza necesaria para realizar sus actividades con normalidad, tuvo la idea de dedicarse al alquiler de algunas habilitaciones, pues su casa es muy grande Vivir sola era algo muy triste y ahora puede compartir con sus inquilinos, quienes le hacen compañía. Es así que Mary se ocupa de brindar las mejores condiciones de vida a sus inquilinos, quienes se sienten contentos de vivir en la casa de doña Mary, pues ella los trata con mucho  amor y paciencia, sobre todo al momento de pagar sus pensiones. Pero ahora Mary requiere de mayor inversión, pues tiene proyectado construir el segundo nivel de su casa para hospedar a más  personas y auto sostener sus gastos. Este es su crédito número 14 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, estos préstamos le permitieron  generarse mayores ingresos, y sobre todo desarrollar sus habilidades en su banco comunal donde realizan diversas actividades. Con los 2000 soles solicitados comprará los materiales de construcción que requiere para la construcción del segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Mary is 70 years old. As a mother she has tried to strengthen herself in order to help her children in their various professions so that she won’t feel like a burden at home as her children live with their own families. Since she doesn’t have the strength needed to do her work with normalcy, she had the idea of renting some rooms as her house is very big. Living alone was something very sad and now she can share her home with her renters, who provide company for her. This is why Mary works to provide better living conditions for her renters, who are happy to live in her home as she treats them with much love and patience, and are timely with their rent payments. But now Mary needs an inversion of capital, as she is planning to build a second story to her home in order to house more people and support herself. This is her 14th loan with Micofinanzas PRISMA. These loans enable her to generate greater income and above all develop her abilities in the communal bank where the members have diverse jobs. With the 2000 soles she will buy construction materials she needs to build the second floor of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to add a second story to her home

loans.name: Betilu

texts.es:
Betilu es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Betilu es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Betilu tiene una tienda en la galería S. Rosa en donde vende loceria, cristalería, producto que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo que también viaja a provincia con los mismos productos.
Betilu necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos y platos.
Los sueños de Betilu son ampliar su negocio con mas productos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Betilu is a member of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II.” Betilu has a partner, is 32 years old and has 2 children. Betilu has a store in the S. Rosa gallery where she sells housewares, glass products, items that she acquires in Lima. She runs her business with the help of her husband who also travels the province with the products. Betilu needs a loan for 1350 soles to invest in buying glasses and plates. Betilu dreams of expanding her business with more products and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glasses and plates

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es: Tomás es un hombre muy entregado a su familia, ya que el bienestar de sus 2 hijos son la prioridad para él y su esposa, con quienes vive en la casa de su suegro. Desde que contrajo matrimonio invirtió su dinero en la compra de un automóvil, con el cual trabaja desde hace 16 años por las calles de su ciudad brindando el servicio de taxi. Tomás inicia su trabajo a las 5 de la mañana, horario en el cual escasean los buses de transporte público, aprovechando esta demanda y termina su labor a la media noche, pues trata de obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Por otro lado, Tomás es muy prudente ante el peligro de que le roben su auto, por lo que se acompaña de su pareja durante las horas peligrosas para no correr riesgos. Ahora tiene pensado adquirir una nueva movilidad, la cual alquilaría y sólo administraría sus ganancias, sin dejar de trabajar con su taxi. Este es su primer crédito individual con MFP, ya que su trabajo siempre fue dentro de un grupo, pero por sus necesidades urgentes decidió incrementar su capital de trabajo y espera seguir contando con Microfinanzas PRISMA, quien le brinda lo necesario para el desarrollo de su negocio. Los 3200 soles que solicita le permitirán arreglar las fallas técnicas que tiene su auto para que trabaje con normalidad.
texts.en:
Tomás is a dedicated family man, as the well-being of his 2 children are the priority for him and his wife. They live in his father-in-law’s home. Since they married he invested his money in buying an automobile, with which he has worked for 16 years in his city providing taxi service. Tomás begins his work at 5 in the morning, an hour when there are few public buses, taking advantage of the demand, and he finished his work at midnight. He tries to obtain the greatest amount of earnings needed to meet his household needs. On the other hand, Tomás is very prudent about the danger of his car being stolen, so his wife accompanies him during the dangerous hours so as not to take any risks. Now he is thinking about renting a new vehicle, which he will rent and manage its earnings, without stopping his own taxi service. This is his first individual loan with MFP, as his work was always in a group before, but because of urgent needs he decided to increase his working capital and he hopes to continue counting on Microfinanzas PRISMA to provide him the necessary support for his business. The 3200 soles that he seeks will allow him to fix the mechanical problems his car has so that it works normally.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his taxi

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo es un hombre de noble corazón que sólo desea el progreso de sus hijos y el bienestar de su hogar. Desde que migró a la capital tuvo el deseo de progresar, por lo que se dedicó a diversas actividades con las que pudo reunir el dinero necesario para adquirir un auto, el cual obtuvo hace  15 años, y desde entonces, está dedicado a brindar el servicio de taxi. Para ello, recorre las calles de su localidad desde muy temprano en la madrugada y hasta la fecha viene solventando las necesidades de su hogar con esta labor. Sin embargo, ahora Guillermo está poniendo en marcha un nuevo proyecto, la venta de quesos, los cuales compra en otras ciudades y los trae a Lima para venderlos y así incrementar sus ganancias. Guillermo es parte de un banco comunal y lo que lo motiva a seguir siendo parte de MFP es el optimismo y compromiso de sus compañeros en busca de su mutuo desarrollo económico y social. Los 1800 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su carro y mercadería para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a good-hearted man who only wants to provide for his children’s wellbeing and see them get ahead. He moved to the capital with a desire to succeed, so he worked in a number of different jobs so that he could raise enough money to buy a car. He started a taxi service and has been in business for 15 years. He cruises through the streets of his neighborhood early in the morning and, so far, he has been able to meet his household needs doing this type of work.

However, Guillermo is launching a new business selling cheese. He buys the product in other cities and sells them in Lima to increase his earnings. Guillermo is a member of a communal bank that motivates him to remain with MFP. He is optimistic and committed to his fellow bank members in their desire to achieve economic and social development.

The 1800 soles he is requesting will be used to purchase spare parts for his taxi and merchandise for his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma es una mujer que busca ser un buen apoyo para su esposo en el desarrollo de su familia, pues sus 3 hijos son su prioridad. Desde que su pareja dejó de trabajar como transportista, ella empezó a administrar su carro, el cual alquila durante el día, tratando de estar pendiente de las fallas técnicas en el funcionamiento y los accidentes que puedan suscita durante el trascurso del día, pues alquila su movilidad desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, tiempo que el conductor trabaja en diversos lugares de la ciudad haciendo taxi. Por ello siempre tiene cuidado con la contratación de la persona que trabajará en su carro, pues la cantidad de delincuentes pone en riesgo su negocio. Asimismo, Irma ayuda a su esposo en la compra y venta de repuestos para autos, ya que es el negocio al que él se dedica, actividad que ella realiza con mucho gusto, ya que el progreso de su familia es la prioridad para ambos y esperan seguir mejorando en sus ingresos para instalar un taller de mecánica en su casa. Este es su 7mo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, los anteriores préstamos le permitieron mejorar su negocio y sus relaciones sociales, ya que trabaja con mucho esmero junto con sus compañeras con miras al progreso de su banco comunal. Con los 1500 soles que solicita realizará el mantenimiento de su carro, el cual requiere de algunas reparaciones para su normal funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Irma is a woman who seeks to be a good helpmate to her husband in the development of their family, since their 3 children take priority. Since her husband stopped working as a driver, she started renting out his car as a taxi. It gets rented out during the day, from 5am to 7pm, and the drivers travel to different parts of the city. Irma makes sure the vehicle is maintained and she also monitors traffic throughout the day for accidents. She is always careful in recruiting drivers because anyone with a criminal record threatens her business.

Irma also helps her husband buying and selling automobile parts, a line of work that he enjoys very much. Her family’s wellbeing is a priority for both of them and they hope to improve their earnings by opening a auto repair shop in their home.

This is Irma’s 7th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her previous loans allowed her to improve her business and her social network. She works together with the other members to help the communal bank succeed. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will pay for car maintenance since her vehicle requires some repairs in order to function normally.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto maintenance

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora y una buena madre de familia, se dedica al cuidado de sus 4 hijos, quienes son estudiantes; y junto con su pareja lograron construir su propia vivienda. Hace 20 años viene trabajando al lado de su esposo en la venta de pescado, al por mayor, en el mercado de su localidad, gracias a estos años de experiencia ha logrado conseguir gran cantidad  de clientes, quienes son comerciantes minoristas. Pero para realizar esta actividad tiene que despertar de madrugada y salir rumbo al mercado donde trasporta grandes cantidades de mercadería para luego venderla a sus clientes, es por ello que desde tempranas horas tiene que estar pendiente de su negocio, terminando su labor a las 10 de la mañana, hora que regresa a su hogar para atender a sus hijos. Es así que Isabel viene trabajando y desea seguir realizándolo por mucho años más, ya que tiene proyectado comprar un auto para trasportar sus pescados a diversos lugares de la ciudad. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, Isabel refiere que sus anteriores créditos fueron de gran ayuda en su desarrollo personal y en el de sus compañeras de banco comunal. Los 2000 soles que solicita posibilitarán la mejora de su capital de trabajo, pues comprará mayor cantidad de pescado.
texts.en:
Isabel is a hardworking woman and a good mother to her family. She takes care of her 4 children who are students, and together with her husband, they have built their own home. For 20 years, she has worked alongside her husband selling fish at the wholesale market in their town. Thanks to their years of experience they have been able to attract a large number of customers, who are mostly retail merchants. Their day begins at dawn when they head to the market where large quantities of merchandise arrive for them to sell to their customers. The early hours are when they do their best business, ending their work day at 10am. This allows them to return home to care for their children.

Isabel hopes to continue working for many more years and plans to buy a car to transport fish to different places in the city. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Isabel says her previous loans helped her with her own personal development and that of her fellow communal bank members. The loan of 2000 soles that she is requesting will improve her operating capital and will be used to purchase large quantities of fish.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús es una mujer que sigue trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos, pues es separada y el cuidado de ellos es su total responsabilidad. Ella es comerciante desde hace muchos años atrás, pero en la venta de ropa lleva 16 años, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana en el centro de su ciudad, pero también ofrece sus prendas a sus vecinos y amigos, dejándoles la ropa al crédito. Una de sus metas es instalar un puesto de venta de ropa donde trabaje de una manera más calmada y sin tener que movilizarse a diversos lugares, para esto tiene que seguir trabajando en las calles y tocando las puertas a sus vecinos y clientes durante el día. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, los 1800 soles que viene solicitando los usará en la compra de mercadería para atender los últimos pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jesús is a woman who is always working for the well being of her children, since she is separated and has full responsibility for their care. She has been in business since way back when, but has been selling clothing for sixteen years. She works at this every day starting at 9am in the city center, but she also sells her garments to her neighbors and friends, letting them have it on credit. One of her goals is to set up a stand for selling clothing where she can work more peacefully without having to move from place to place. But to do this she has to continue working in the streets and knocking on the doors of her neighbors and customers during the day. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. The 1,800 Sols that she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise in order to fill recent orders from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 44 años, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, y lo que espera es brindarle las mejores atenciones en la casa que construyó con mucho esfuerzo junto a su pareja. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de su localidad, donde ha trabajado por más de 10 años y donde se ha desempeñado como una excelente trabajadora. Todas las mañanas sale desde las 4 de la madrugada rumbo a su puesto, ya que desde tempranas horas hay que seleccionar los pescados que comprará para luego venderlos a los comerciantes, pues ella es mayorista de este producto. A partir de las 10 de la mañana, realiza las cobranzas a sus clientes en los alrededores del mercado, ya que también le solicitan este producto al crédito. Esta actividad la inició junto a su pareja, con quien ahora tiene planes de adquirir un camión para trasportar los pescados hasta los mercados de su localidad y venderlos en cantidades mayores, pues es un negocio muy rentable, debido a la demanda que hay en los mercados. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, su permanencia en su banco comunal le ha permitido mejorar sus relaciones interpersonales y apoyarse en sus compañeras de grupo en diversas circunstancias difíciles. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, y así seguir reuniendo el dinero necesario para la compra del camión que requiere.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 44 year old woman who is very dedicated to her family. She hopes to take care of the house that she and her husband are building together. She sells fish in the local market, where she has worked for more than 10 years. Maritza is an excellent worker. Every morning she leaves at 4am to head to her vending post where she selects the fish that she will sell to her customers, who are mostly retail merchants. By 10 am, she has collected payments from her customers around the market but she also has some who ask to buy on credit. She started her business with her husband, who plans to buy a truck so that they can transport fish to other markets in town and sell in larger quantities. Her business is very profitable because of the high demand in the markets.

Maritza is on her 5th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her membership in the communal bank has allowed her to improve her interpersonal relationships and build support from her group in times of difficult circumstances. With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy a large quantity of merchandise to increase her sales and her earnings. She will continue to save toward the purchase of the truck that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 25 años, vive con su hermano, con quien comparte las mismas actividades, juntos buscan progresar fuera de su tierra natal, y hasta la fecha han lograron obtener una casa propia, la cual construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo. Desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios se interesó por tener un negocio propio, pero sus condiciones económicas no le dieron la oportunidad de iniciarlo y para lograr sus metas tuvo que realizar diversos trabajos de ventas en los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad. Al paso de los años consiguió el capital que requería, y junto a su hermano lograron instalar un puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado más popular de la capital, donde la gran concurrencia beneficia su negocio. Sin embargo, la demanda es muy exigente, tienen que variar y estar pendiente de las últimas colecciones en moda, tanto para hombres y mujeres. Es así que trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, tiempo en que trata de brindar a sus clientes las mejores atenciones para asegurar su retorno. Ahora, su próxima meta es adquirir otro puesto para  incrementar sus ventas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se compromete a trabajar de una forma responsable para poder solicitar próximos créditos. Los 2000 soles que solicita le brindaran la oportunidad de incrementar la mercadería con la cual viene trabajando hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Angel is 25 years old. He lives with his brother and shares activities with him. Together they looked for opportunities outside of their birthplace. As of this date, they have obtained their own home, which took quite a bit of effort. Since Angel has finished his secondary studies, he has been interested in having his own business. Economic conditions had not allowed him to begin this business. To achieve his goals, he had to work at different sales jobs in the crowded markets of the city. After several years he obtained the capital that he needed and with his brother they purchased a booth where they sell clothes in the most popular market in the city. The large crowds in this market help their business. Never the less, the customers are very particular. The brothers have to provide a variety of clothing They also must provide the latest styles for men and women. It is in this manner that they work from eight in the morning until eleven at night. During this time they try to provide their customers with the best service in order to insure that they return. Now their next goal is to acquire another booth in order increase their sales. This is their first loan with PRISMA Microfinance. They promise to work in a responsible manner so that they can qualify for more loans in the future. The 2000 soles that they ask for will allow them to increase their inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their inventory

loans.name: Ketti

texts.es: Ketti tiene 40 años y lo que más desea es brindarles lo necesario a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que le tomó varios años conseguir. Sus ganas de progresar la llevaron a desempeñarse en múltiples actividades, siendo una de ellas ser miembro de la Policía Municipal, quienes se caracterizan por el cuidado y orden dentro de los mercados. Por otro lado, vendía abarrotes, pero este negocio fracasó porque se trasladó a otro distrito de su ciudad, lo cual la obligó a cambiar de rubro de trabajo, siendo la venta de ropa una de sus mejores opciones. Ahora está iniciando este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus amistades, quienes la motivan, además sabe que sus contactos dentro del mercado beneficiarán su desarrollo. La prioridad actual de Ketti es crecer con esta actividad a base de mucha responsabilidad y esfuerzo, pues quiere empezar su negocio con suma eficiencia, ya que su anhelo a futuro es obtener un puesto donde pueda vender grandes cantidades de productos diversos. Este es su 14avo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera que en su banco comunal sigan trabajando con las mismas ganas y esmero por su progreso como grupo organizado. Los 3000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán adquirir la mercadería que requiere para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Ketti is 40 years old and desires to provide for her family’s basic needs. She lives with her husband and 2 children in a house that took several years to build. Ketti has multiple sources of income. She is a member of the municipal police force, who are known for being watchful and preserving order in the marketplace.

At one time she sold groceries, but that business failed because she moved to another district within the city. She was forced to change her line of work, so selling clothes appeared to be the best option. Ketti started her business with the support of friends who motivated her. She also knew a few contacts in the market who could help her business develop. With great responsibility and effort, her main priority is to generate more activity. She then wants to start operating her business more efficiently because she hopes to start selling larger quantities of different products in the future.

This is Ketty’s 14th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She hopes that her communal bank will continue to work with the same amount of enthusiasm, dedication and organization. She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase merchandise for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dionisia Yolanda Luisa
